jobs.title: Senior Communications Advisor, Executive Communications
jobs.via: via Intact Careers - Intact Financial Corporation
jobs.description:
Our employees are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. When you join our team, you’re bringing this purpose to life alongside a passionate community of experts.

Feel empowered to learn and grow while being valued for who you are– here, diversity is a strength. You have our commitment to support you in reaching your goals with tools, opportunities, and flexibility. It’s our employee promise.

Our hybrid work model provides the balance between working from home and enjoying meaningful in-person interactions.

Read on to see how you can shape the future, win as a team, and grow with us.

About the role

We're looking for an Senior Communications Advisor, Executive Communications for our growing team !

Within the CA&C team, the executive communications team is responsible for developing and executing communication plans that elevate the profile of C-suite executives and share the key elements of... Intact’s strategy. This includes the management of various executive engagements, internal and external events, employee blogs and social media accounts.

As a senior communication advisor, you have the opportunity to work in close collaboration with Intact’s CEO and leadership team by putting forward strategic communication initiatives. In this position, you will also interact with colleagues across the organization to learn about the business, share news and examples, and create content to support Intact’s storytelling efforts.

The Corporate Affairs & Communications team

The Corporate Affairs & Communications (CA&C) team focuses on reputational management by providing Internal and External Communications, Government Relations and Social Impact solutions that support IFC’s business objectives and 10-year strategic roadmap.

This includes:
• Supporting and amplifying the common elements that bring us together, define our unique culture and drive outperformance
• Protecting and promoting the IFC brand and reputation globally
• Elevating IFC’s role in helping to build resilient communities where we do business
• Creating and amplifying thought leadership content to share IFC’s knowledge and expertise
• Enhancing employee engagement across IFC – emphasize what makes us a winning team

Key Responsibilities:
• Act as a trusted advisor and develop strong relationships with senior leaders across the business
• Develops and executes communications plans that support Intact’s objectives, drives engagement and elevates C-suite profiles
• Shows strong project management including of workback schedules, content feedback and approvals, coordination of various task owners, and reporting and measurement
• Works with key communication colleagues across CA&C to assess communication opportunities for executives. Ensure ideas are fitting, aligned with strategic priorities and determine the best approach to execute on them
• Demonstrate strategic thinking by ensuring alignment of messaging and approach with all Intact brands and regions
• Create, review, edit and adapt executive communications pieces (announcements, briefing notes, speeches, video scripts, social media posts, etc.) to reach various audiences in a meaningful way such as employees, shareholders, investors, and general public
• Implements and manages internal events, including close collaboration with IT and external vendors, and development of key elements of the attendee experience such as branding, engagement opportunities, program agenda and content
• Produce compelling digital profile of leaders aligned with their thought leadership strategy
• Conducts research to support team decision-making, and continuous improvement

An Ideal Candidate Demonstrates
• Leadership and makes informed decisions quickly
• Ease to work in a fast-paced and changing environment
• Ability to prioritize
• Keen desire to learn and progress in your career
• Capacity to draw simple, engaging, and meaningful messages from complex content
• Excellent communications skills to build relationships and collaborate with others
• Committed to delivering high standards of quality work
• Striving to live the Intact Values everyday

Specific Experience/Requirements and Working Conditions
• Individual contributor role
• 7+ years’ relevant experience in journalism or communications in an agency or fast-paced environment
• Experience creating strategic communications plans (from research to measurement) and designing strategies to meet organizational objectives
• Proven ability to build and execute plans to enhance employee engagement
• Proven ability to deliver work on time, and to manage multiple projects and expectations simultaneously
• Highly computer literate with strong command of MS Office suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Sharepoint, etc.)
• Preferred: Bilingual or working proficiency of French because need to interact on a regular basis with colleagues across the country

What we offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:
• A financial rewards program that recognizes your success
• An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased
• An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare
• Flexible work arrangements
• Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year
• An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle
• Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues
• A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs
• Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities
• Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow
• A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

If you are an employee of Intact or belairdirect, please apply for this role on Contact People

jobs.title: Platform Developer -Toronto
jobs.description:
Please continue reading if you are a Software Developer, Backend or Platform Engineer who likes Python programming, properly structured cloud infrastructure, solving complex technical problems, building tools and working directly with customers. If you are equally passionate about cloud infra as we are, and you want to be part of a new Tech Ops Team being set up in Canada, and contribute to a very well funded scale-up company, we want to hear from you!

This position is a combination of software development, problem solving and direct customer interaction. We are looking for talented Developers to help our customers integrate with our cloud operations platform which turns the best open source technologies into frustration-free cloud services. Our customers are primarily developers with a good understanding of technology, and, along with our entire development team, you will be helping them succeed using Aiven services. Your development skills are required for creating and improving... our support tooling as well as developing and implementing new features requested by customers.

Responsibilities
• Work with complex open source databases such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, InfluxDB, Redis, as well as other open source data technologies like Kafka, Elasticsearch, Cassandra and Grafana
• Developing tooling for internal teams, customers and partners
• Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues with help from the product and operations teams
• Customer support: triage, driving support cases to closure, escalation to other teams
• Drive cross-functional user-experience and supportability improvements
• Maintaining internal and external product knowledge bases
• Provide feedback to Aiven sales and product development teams
• Continuous improvement of the processes and tooling for all of the above

Requirements
• 4-5 years of software development experience, (preferably backend or platform engineering)
• Extensive Python programming experience (Please Note: we are not looking for web developers)
• Demonstrated cloud computing experience
• Demonstrated experience working with database and messaging systems such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Grafana, InfluxDB, Redis and Kafka
• At least intermediate level Linux and networking experience
• Demonstrated experience troubleshooting issues and resolving customer issues in a timely manner
• Previous experience working directly with customers, would be an asset
• Experience in writing technical blog posts would also be an asset
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate clearly, concisely and effectively with customers and colleagues
• Fast learner - Ability to pick up new and unfamiliar technologies quickly
• Experience contributing to open source technologies would be an added bonus

Benefits
• A dynamic startup environment with a rapidly growing, international business
• Highly experienced colleagues
• Lots of space and freedom to be yourself and act as an owner

What we can offer
• Participation in employee stock option plan
• Comprehensive Benefits program including private Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
• Mobile phone and subscription
• Flexible working hours
• Office snacks, soft drinks, treats and fruits

If you’re interested, send us your application along with a link to your GitHub profile.

Aiven focuses on Cloud Computing, B2B, Databases, and Distributed Systems. Their company has offices in Helsinki. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://aiven.io or find them on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Product Hunt

jobs.title: Knowledge Broker, Ontario Hepatitis C Program
jobs.description:
A. Primary Role

The Knowledge Broker, Ontario Hepatitis C Program is the primary resource within CATIE for the implementation of CATIE’s hepatitis C knowledge broker work in Ontario, including coordinating and implementing activities for the Ontario Hepatitis C Teams Network. This role will also support other hepatitis C knowledge exchange initiatives with key provincial partners and complementary work in harm reduction. This position is supervised by the Associate Director, Ontario Hepatitis C and Harm Reduction Programming. The location of this position is flexible in Ontario, and can be full-time remote or a combination of remote and at the CATIE office in Toronto. This position will also occasionally travel within Ontario.

B. Key Responsibilities

Job Responsibility #1: Leads the coordination and implementation of customized capacity building and knowledge exchange activities for the Ontario Hepatitis C Teams Network (35%)

1. Coordinates and implements customized capacity... building and knowledge exchange activities for the Ontario Hepatitis C Teams Network.

a. Leads the planning, implementation and evaluation of virtual and in-person activities for the Hepatitis C Teams Network (including workshops, online learning, presentations and coordinating external trainings).

b. Leads the delivery of online and in-person network events, including presenting, facilitating and providing technical support.

c. Collaborates with external speakers, Ontario Hepatitis C Teams Network members, and other CATIE staff to plan and deliver activities.

2. Maintains a centralized coordination and secretariat function to support the Ontario Hepatitis C Teams network.

a. Leads consultations and engagement to identify the hepatitis C and harm reduction capacity building and network needs of the Hepatitis C Teams.

b. Coordinates communication to the Ontario Hepatitis C Teams Network, including overseeing the public-facing website, online discussion group, and email announcements.

c. Maintains the contact list for the Ontario Hepatitis C Teams Network, and acts as the main point of contact for questions, inquiries or requests.

d. Supports coordination and communication with the key stakeholders related to the Ontario Hepatitis C Teams Network

Job Responsibility #2: Coordinates and implements broader knowledge exchange and capacity building activities as part of CATIE’s Ontario hepatitis C knowledge broker function (30%)

1. Facilitates collaboration and coordination with key provincial stakeholders across the provincial system responding to Hepatitis C.

a. Maintains relationships with provincial hepatitis C clinical and community stakeholders and partners.

b. Supports coordination, communication and overall collaboration with stakeholders as part of Ontario hepatitis C initiatives.

c. Provides content expertise in the areas of hepatitis C, knowledge exchange and community engagement for provincial initiatives.

2. Coordinates and implements capacity building activities in collaboration with provincial stakeholders for a variety of audiences in hepatitis C and related areas

a. Organizes virtual or in-person events (e.g., webinars, educational events, dialogues) for primarily frontline hepatitis C service providers or program planners.

b. Public speaking as a presenter or facilitator at both virtual and in-person events

c. Produces capacity building materials including planning documents, educational materials and presentations.

Job Responsibility #3: Supports the uptake of hepatitis C knowledge within the organization and with external stakeholders (20%)

1. Shares knowledge of emerging hepatitis C trends, practices or issues in Ontario within CATIE as needed to inform work by other teams.

2. Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to assess new developments and plan knowledge exchange activities to share relevant learnings with Ontario stakeholders.

3. Supports the development of other CATIE-created knowledge products in writing, reviewer, advisor or other roles as requested.

Job Responsibility #4: Supports the coordination and implementation of harm reduction knowledge exchange and capacity building activities to support a network of harm reduction outreach workers (15%)

1. Work closely with the Ontario CATIE team to support the consultation, collaboration and engagement of a separate network of harm reduction workers.

2. Works with Ontario CATIE team to support the coordination and implementation of harm reduction knowledge exchange and capacity building activities, including virtual and in-person events (meetings, online learning, webinars)

C. Knowledge and Skills Required

1. Graduate level education and experience in health sciences, public health, adult education or a related discipline.

2. An understanding of frontline, community health practice. Experience working in frontline hepatitis C, harm reduction or related programs is an asset.

3. Understanding of the knowledge exchange process and principles.

4. Research skills and experience in identifying, gathering, evaluating, interpreting and synthesizing information from external sources, particularly scientific and medical journals, online databases and grey literature.

5. Demonstrated ability to design and execute creative, engaging, and useful virtual and in-person educational and capacity building initiatives.

6. Superior writing and editing skills with the ability to explain complex information using clear and simple language.

7. Superior verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate in an empathetic manner using clear language and presentation and group facilitation skills.

8. Understanding of health equity, social justice and harm reduction principles.

9. Excellent project management skills and experience.

10. Demonstrated ability to work independently, to set priorities and work schedules to meet deadlines, and the ability to be tactful, discreet and sensitive to confidential matters.

11. Ability and willingness to work occasional weekend and evening hours.

12. Ability and willingness to travel within Ontario up to three times per year to a maximum of 10 business days.

13. Ability to work flexibly and take on a variety of tasks as a member of a small team.

14. Knowledge of CATIE’s mandate, program direction and service philosophy to support development and implementation of program management.

15. Proficiency in spoken and written English required.

16. Proficiency working in a virtual setting, including using Microsoft Office programs, Microsoft SharePoint, and videoconferencing software.

Our team includes people from diverse cultural, ethnic and linguistic backgrounds. Although we are proud to offer all of our activities in French and English, internal communications are mostly in English.

CATIE is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from Black, Indigenous and racialized people, people of all gender identities and sexual orientations, and people with disabilities. CATIE also recognizes the need for experience, knowledge and guidance from communities disproportionately affected by HIV and hepatitis C, including people living with HIV or with current or lived experience of hepatitis C or substance use.

HIV and hepatitis C disproportionately affect many racialized communities, yet these communities are underrepresented in paid staff positions of many HIV and hepatitis C organizations, including CATIE. We are working to change this by prioritizing anti-racism in our work and our operations, and striving to create a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment for racialized people to work and thrive.

Interested applicants should visit our website at www.catie.ca.

E-mail applications preferred. No phone calls, please. We thank you for your interest, however, only those applicants to be interviewed will be contacted.

Salary: $60,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

jobs.title: Sr. C/C++ Developer (refactoring/bug fixing)
jobs.description:
If you do not have refactoring from C to C++ or bug fixing (10+ years), your application will not be considered!

At DesAcc, our mission is to achieve a healthier humanity by unlocking and delivering imaging, phenotypic and genomics health data at scale. To do so, we develop and deliver software solutions for enabling healthcare data access to machine learning algorithms and other health data consumers. We believe that today’s data contains the answers to global health challenges and unlocking data silos is essential to creating and inspiring cures. At DesAcc we love unlocking, understanding, integrating and delivering data, we are 'DataVores' at heart and in mind.

Role Summary:

As a Senior C/C ++ Developer, you will be responsible for refactoring, identifying and resolving software bugs and issues within

DesAcc software. Your expertise will contribute to ensuring the smooth operation and reliability of our software applications.

What you will do
• Utilize your strong C/C++ coding... skills to refactor and debug issues across various versions of C and C++.
• Provide general code maintenance and work on improving stability, reliability and performance of the codebase.
• Contribute to the modernization program by utilizing your familiarity with refactoring techniques and actively participating in codebase improvements.
• Identify and categorize bugs based on their impact and priority, ensuring efficient bug tracking and resolution processes.
• Independently fix bugs wherever possible, employing your expertise in debugging techniques and code analysis and escalating more serious issues to the Product Development team
• Collaborate with the Product Development team to escalate and address more serious or complex issues.
• Able to undertake unplanned work in response to larger business requirements
• Work closely with the Product team to categorize crash reports and identify patterns in support tickets, enabling efficient issue resolution.
• Respond promptly and effectively to unplanned work in alignment with larger business requirements.
• Foster effective communication and teamwork, collaborating with cross-functional teams to share knowledge, coordinate bug fixes, and deliver high-quality software.
• Apply your Help Desk knowledge to assist in setting up and optimizing software support processes.

What you will need (Required Qualifications)

Formal education or equivalent
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

Years of experience
• Should have at least 10 years of relevant work experience

Competencies
• Self-management
• Teamwork
• Responsibility
• Problem Analysis
• Problem Solving
• Creative Thinking
• Decision Making
• Communication

Specialized skills, knowledge or certifications unique to this role
• Experience in the Healthcare Industry is desirable.
• Strong C/C++ coding, refactoring and debugging skills
• DICOM experience is an asset
• Good working knowledge of Software Development and Help Desk solutions like JIRA, Backlog, Tuleap or similar.
• Working knowledge of Windows and Linux Server and Networking.
• Ability to work remotely and effectively in a fast-paced, agile development environment, and experience with DevOps practices and tools such as GITEA, and Jenkins.

Why you will love DesAcc:

We are a scaleup, now expanded into North America. At DesAcc we are committed to providing a mutually respectful work environment. We believe diversity and equal employment opportunities among our teammates are critical to our success as a global business. We provide a collaborative work environment and seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented professionals from a diverse candidate pool across the globe. At DesAcc everyone is an owner, bringing their unique perspective to our team and products. Your voice is important, and we take having a culture based on feedback seriously. We openly share our thoughts to keep decisions decentralized and ensure all team members contribute. You will learn, grow, and be celebrated for your hard work and great attitude!
• Competitive salary
• Paid Holiday entitlement
• Health & Wellness days
• Dental/Vision/Health insurance - No waiting period (FT)
• Laptop and monitor(s) (other equipment to support this as required)
• Professional Development Stipend
• Paid social events
• Remote with occasional meetings in the UK or in the Toronto office.

At DesAcc, we believe diversity and inclusion is a strength we cultivate. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer and we do not discriminate based on race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

Our work environment welcomes equity, inclusiveness, and diversity by providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process and during your employment here. If you require accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Please contact us at hr@desacc.com

jobs.title: Bookkeeper
jobs.description:
Your new company

Hays Recruitment has partnered up with a Renewable Energy company in Toronto, ON. Our client is looking to hire a 6-month contract Part-Time Bookkeeper to join their team. This role follows an in-office working model with the option to be remote.

Your new role
• Perform cash entry in originating entity, record i/c in contracting entity (Must understand multiple entities, i.e importance of segregating activity in each entity
• Multiple currencies, USD and CAD, ensuring certain transactions remain in their underlying currency.
• Re-valuation of currency, at end of month, quarterly, year-end duties etc.

What you'll need to succeed

• Good accounting knowledge

What you'll get in return

The opportunity to work for a company that is founded with a vision to create a clean and sustainable future for our communities. Our client focuses on the development of distributed as well as utility-scale energy resources such as solar and energy storage

jobs.title: Senior Infrastructure Manager
jobs.description:
At Ripple, we’re building a world where value moves like information does today. It’s big, it’s bold, and we’re already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.

If you’re ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.

THE WORK

In this role, you will lead/manage a team that oversees the infrastructure, Internal Development Platform and continuous availability and reliability for the RippleNet services and other Ripple products. The role will span overseeing the development and reliability of key infrastructural components related to compute, build, integration, deployment , secure access among... others. You are someone who is acutely focussed on site reliability but also has a close pulse on the internal engineering experience, and makes good tradeoffs on what to build and why. You understand how to build Internal Developer Platforms and ways to make continual progress and delivery without getting bogged down by complexity. You have good mechanisms to assess reliability, availability , latency and cost and ensure the right instrumentation is in place to enable these to be reviewed and improved. You are a force multiplier for developers and application owners in the organization.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
• Lead and inspire a team of Infrastructure engineers to continuously deliver availability and reliability of Ripple products
• Have good instincts for Platform Engineering and developing Internal Developer Platforms
• Building and operating production software at internet scale
• Balancing bias to action with the ability to make well-informed bets
• Collaborating closely with our key partners as well as engaging directly with engineering customers to understand their needs and improve their experience
• Owning, creating and maintaining processes & tooling for infrastructure organization, adding your own tooling and processes.
• Support operations for infrastructure features and services
• Build in observability for internal infrastructure services as well as provide related observability frameworks for applications
• Minimize our mean time to resolve incidents by reacting to monitoring alerts, problems reported by employees or customers in a timely manner

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:
• Strong familiarity with AWS tools and services
• 10+ years of total experience with 5+ years of management experience in building and leading diverse software infrastructure engineering teams.
• Experience building & operating highly reliable distributed systems in a cloud environment
• Customer-focused curiosity, passion for technology, pragmatic thinking, ability to jump into an ambiguous area, and break down complex problems
• Demonstrated experience in improving the reliability and operational automation of complex, multi-tier systems
• A strong product mindset along with experience in delivering large complex projects collaborating with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders that are technology, operations or business focused.
• Experience with monitoring systems and incident management
• Experience operating software as a service
• Experience working in the FinTech a plus
• Experience participating in incident response

WHO WE ARE:

Do Your Best Work
• The opportunity to build in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
• A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact. A professional development budget to support other modes of learning.
• Thrive in an environment where no matter what race, ethnicity, gender, origin, or culture they identify with, every employee is a respected, valued, and empowered part of the team.
• Ripple is Flexible First: you have the option to work from home, from our offices, or a combination of the two around our centers of gravity (15 global offices).
• Weekly all-company meeting - business updates and ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
• We come together for moments that matter which include team offsites, team bonding activities, happy hours and more!

Take Control of Your Finances
• Competitive salary, bonuses, and equity
• Competitive benefits that cover physical and mental healthcare, retirement, family forming, and family support
• Employee giving match
• Mobile phone stipend

Take Care of Yourself
• Twice a quarter R&R days so you can rest and recharge
• Generous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite & virtual programming
• Generous vacation policy - work with your manager to take time off when you need it
• Industry-leading parental leave policies. Family planning benefits.
• Catered lunches, fully-stocked kitchens with premium snacks/beverages, and plenty of fun events
• Benefits listed above are for full-time Ripple employees. For all Metaco roles, please discuss benefits with your recruiter. *

Ripple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance. Please find our UK/EU Applicant Privacy Notice and our California Applicant Privacy Notice for reference.

Ripple focuses on Internet, Enterprise Software, Financial Services, Payments, and Banking. Their company has offices in New York City, San Francisco, Dubai, Singapore, and Washington DC. They have a large team that's between 501-1000 employees. To date, Ripple has raised $290.7M of funding; their latest round was closed on December 2019.

You can view their website at http://ripple.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Product Hunt

jobs.title: Personal Support Worker - Private Duty Care

C-Care is a healthcare staffing agency with over 20 years of experience in providing high quality care services to homes and healthcare facilities. We are providing temporary staffing assignments to hospitals in downtown Toronto.

We offer professional and dedicated healthcare services to private homes, hospitals, rehabilitation facilities, long-term care facilities, nursing homes, retirement residences, clinics, outpatient wellness, and company workplace settings. jobs.title: Information and Program Facilitator
jobs.company: BGC East Scarborough (Formally Boys and Girls Club)
jobs.description:
JOB PURPOSE

The Information and Program Facilitator connects families to appropriate services and provides a welcoming and safe atmosphere for families. Responds appropriately to requests for assistance by providing information and referrals about our programs and services and those in the community. Performs various administrative duties such as maintaining and updating accurate and complete records of all participants by collecting, collating and recording data. Work collaboratively with the Site Supervisor to support the successful implementation of age-appropriate programs and activities for children up to age six and their parents or caregivers.

A. RESPONSIBILITIES

Program Plan and Implementation (30%)

· Follow the E.L.E.C.T. framework, develop and implement age-appropriate, inclusive and culturally diverse learning experiences that support cognitive, emotional, physical and social development of children from an assigned age group ( Ages may range from 18 months to 12... years)

· Ensure the principles in “How Does Learning Happen?” are incorporated in program planning and implementation

· Work in collaboration with all staff to ensure the successful implementation of the daily program which complies with the standards and requirements of the Child Care and Early Years Act, Toronto Children’s Services Assessment of Quality Improvement, Toronto Public Health as well as all other applicable governing bodies

· Submit weekly program plan to centre supervisor for review according to the schedule

· Post the signed program plan prior to the commencement of program on or before the first operating day of each week

· Prepare and set-up program areas prior to the commencement of the program

· Ensure safety and cleanliness of the centre at all times

· Establish a welcoming environment to children, parents and visitors

· Collaborate with the Coordinator to plan, develop and implement monthly specialty program, PA day program and school break programs

Interaction with Children and Parents (40%)

· Actively engage children in learning opportunities

· Actively demonstrate the principles in How Does Learning Happen through the interactions with children and parents

· Ensure health and safety of children are maintained at all time while children are participating in the program

· Facilitate and model positive interactions between child and adult.

· Provide clear guidelines and redirection as well as reinforcement of appropriate behaviours for the children.

· Provide one on one or small group academic support/enrichment to children if needed

· Greet and establish positive communication with parents

Administration (25%)

· Act as the acting supervisor in the absence of the Coordinator. Perform administration and staff supervision duties and oversee the operation of the centre to ensure compliance to all governing regulations and standards.

· Prepare attendance record sheets in advance and have them ready for the coming week

· Maintain accurate records and statistics for the child care centre

· Maintain and update the centre’s daily log

· Collect and record fee payments

· Orient parents and conduct the registration process if required

· Following the agency’s procedures to report working time and submit time-off request accordingly

· Work with the Coordinator to arrange staffing coverage for time-off

· Attend all required staff meetings

· Participate in continuous professional learning annually

· Perform additional tasks and duties as assigned by the Coordinator and/or Manager

Program Promotion (5%)

· Collaborate with the Coordinator to promote the program and attain/maintain full enrolment

B. QUALIFICATIONS

Experience and Training/Education

· College or associate degree diploma in Early Childhood Education or equivalent

· Minimum of 2 year experience as a Registered Early Childhood Educator at a licensed child care centre

· Minimum 2 year full-time experience with children aged 18 months through 12 years, with a focus on kindergarten and school-age

· Proof of current registration with College of Early Childhood Educators in good standing

· Valid Standard First Aid and CPR Training (including infant and child)

· Up to date immunization record

· Clear Police Reference Check

· Valid Safe Food Handling Certificate

· Self-test of Child Care and Early Years Act Completion Certificate

· HIGH FIVE Training is an asset

· Class ‘F’ driver licence is an asset

Knowledge and Attributes

· Working knowledge of the Child Care and Early Years Act, Toronto Children's Services Assessment for Quality Improvement, infection prevention and control guidelines from Toronto Public Health and all other standards, guidelines pertaining to Licensed Child Care Services.

· Working knowledge of the E.L.E.C.T. Framework and How Does Learning Happen?

· Strong ability to plan and implement developmentally appropriate and bias-free hands-on learning experiences for children of various ages

· Strong ability to muti-task and make sound judgment in a fast paced environment

· Strong ability to perform administrative tasks as assigned

· Excellent classroom management and behavior management skills

· Excellent customer skills (including dealing with difficult parents)

· Excellent communication and written skills

· Strong computer skills (e.g. Microsoft Office)

· Previous experience with children with special needs is an asset

· Flexible and reliable

· Self-starter and be able to work independently

· Able to work cooperatively in a team

· Knowledge of the community is an asset.

· Access to a vehicle is an asset.

C. WORKING CONDITIONS

· Flexible and available to work at different Licensed Child Care Services Sites

· Available to work flexible hours (including a split shift) according to child care program needs

· Able to work in a fast paced environment with children

· Able to work in a high noise environment

D. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

· Able to walk to and from school for pick up and drop off of children if required

· Able to stand and walk for an extended period of time

· Able to work in all weather conditions including a minimum of two hour outdoor time actively working with children

· Able to engage children in active gross motor learning activities

· Able to lift small children, cots and other program equipment

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
A. Summary:

Naka is a platform where users can come together at any time and any location to build a meaningful connection. Naka’s platform uniquely merges the virtual and physical world, providing a whole new friend-making experience with entertainment and opportunities.

Our goal is to provide a service to a crowd of 3.8 billion monthly active social networking users. The result is a $200 billion industry for grabs. Through Naka, we can provide 3.8 billion people with the ability to connect in a way that has never been done before.

Naka is in a pre-revenue stage. We started in Jan 2020 at The Hub, a start-up incubator at the University of Toronto in Canada.

Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, university students feel isolated, and based on our interviews, it is extremely difficult for them to network and make new friends. This is why Naka has set an initial launch date for January. We have an unprecedented opportunity where our launch date coincides with the beginning of the year when... people are most eager to meet new friends and form lasting connections.

B. What we’re looking for:

Basic requirements:
• Experience designing UI prototypes using Adobe XD, Photoshop, or other alternatives
• Experience with the MEAN/MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, AngularJS/React, Node.js) or any JS/Python-based web app stack (Django + Angular/React/Bootstrap)
• Experience with cross-platform mobile app development using React Native, or native app development for either iOS (Objective-C/Swift) or Android (Java/Kotlin + Gradle).
• Experience designing REST-ful APIs
• Working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
• Comfortable with git/source control

Bonus requirements:
• Experience integrating with AWS
• Experience with AWS DevOps (Continuous integration and deployment, Kubernetes or Docker on Amazon ECS)
• Experience applying machine learning models/TensorFlow.js
• Experience with Flask / Django
• Familiarity with DevOps practices, including CI/CD, containerization, configuration, monitoring, alerting, etc.
• Web services technology such as REST, JSON, or Thrift

C. The role:

As a full-stack web developer at Pelican Community, you will get the opportunity to:
• Design the foundational backend and frontend infrastructure for our web service
• Design responsive and intuitive user interfaces for mobile and web
• Collaborate with the existing team and advisory board and effectively communicate with other team members
• Iterate quickly while keeping scalability and performance in mind

Hours: Approximately 20 hours per week

If you have any questions, contact us at general@nakaconnect.com.

Compensation: We are an early-stage start-up and cannot pay a salary at the current stage. Team members get equity and paid once we have raised enough funds or revenue.

Naka focuses on Social Media Platforms, Match-Making, Online Friendship, and Mobile Application. Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://nakaconnect.com or find them on Facebook and LinkedIn

jobs.description:

Salary: Negotiable

Date Posted: 11/09/2023

Senior Real-Time Embedded C Electronics Engineer – Aerospace and Robotic Systems – Canada Only

The Job:

As an Embedded C engineer, you will be working with a diverse and dynamic team to change the way people move around the world, whilst reducing carbon emissions.

You will work with world experts in aerospace, robotics, software where to create robust low code embedded software that is up the aerospace standards.

In your job you will focus on embedded programming, electronics, Real-time motion control, robotics and machine learning. You will develop, test and debug your applications.

As an embedded engineer you will need to have a good grasp of the physical world, so a good understanding of physics.

This is a senior job, and we would like to see a strong academic background with solid embedded C experience. It will be a bonus if you have designed electronic and embedded hardware circuits, including... PCBs.

The Company:

My client is changing the engineering world by using the latest cutting-edge technology which will allow people to have better and a faster, reliable transportation network. It will help the planet by saving carbon footprint, and save people travel time and most of all, save money on ticket prices. The team behind the project are professionals from the aerospace and rail industry, and they are the guys that will make a massive difference in the transportation industry, and you have the chance to get involved and do it with them.

Most of the team have a PhD, they are global experts, and they are working on tech that will make your hair stand on end.

Location:

Toronto, Canada – You will want to get your hands on this tech!

Why you Should join:

You will be part of a team of talented professionals working in a dynamic environment with leading new technologies and science that will change the future.

You will be working in teams across Europe and North America which you will contribute and be responsible for urban design and transportation solutions.

You will have the ability to push your skills and learn from leading experts, which includes Ph.Ds and Professors across the world.

They have a fantastic office based in Toronto.

This will be a great opportunity to progress your skill set and advance your senior skills working on Aerospace and Robotic systems.

This will be perfect for you if you are excited about megawatt electrical power and supersonic machines.

What you should do:

If you are a Senior Embedded C Engineer and you would like to apply, click the link and send me your profile.

If you are a Senior Embedded C Engineer and you have questions, then please call Maseeh at initi8 HQ.

If this isn’t for you, but you know the perfect candidate why not refer them to us and an a referral reward #BeTheAgent.

Maseeh

Maseeh@initi8recruitment.com

jobs.title: Associate/Full Professor - Chief, Odette Cancer Program, SHSC ...
jobs.via: via U Of T Jobs - University Of Toronto
jobs.description:
Date Posted: 09/29/2023

Closing Date: 11/20/2023, 11:59PM ET

Req ID: 34179

Job Category: Faculty - Clinical

Faculty/Division: Temerty Faculty of Medicine

Department: Dept of Surgery

Hospital Affiliation: Sunnybrook Health Science Centre

Campus: St. George (Downtown Toronto)

Description:

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre, in Toronto, Canada, a fully affiliated academic Health Sciences facility of the University of Toronto, is inviting applications for the Chief of Odette Cancer Program, Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre and Regional Vice President, Toronto Central North, Ontario Health (Cancer Care Ontario). The candidate must be qualified to hold a clinical full-time academic appointment at the University of Toronto at the rank of Associate Professor or Full Professor. Effective start date is January 1, 2024, or as mutually agreed upon.

Sunnybrook has an ambitious vision to Invent the Future of Health Care. Sunnybrook’s Strategic Plan 2021-25 emphasizes the essential role... that Sunnybrook plays, not only through its tertiary regional and provincial programs, but also supporting the community needs within the North Toronto Ontario Health Team (OHT). Our strategic plan identifies four strategic directions that include personalized and precise treatments; integrated and sustainable models of care across the health system; improving quality and creating a better care experience; and building high performing teams. To learn more about our strategic plan, please visit: https://sunnybrook.ca/content/?page=strategic-plan-2021-25&rr=strategicplan.

The Odette Cancer Program is a regional cancer program, fully affiliated with both Ontario Health (Cancer Care Ontario), and the University of Toronto. It serves as the Regional Cancer Centre for Toronto Central North region offering complex, multi-disciplinary (surgical, medical and radiation oncology) regionalized care for breast, brain and spine, head and neck, lung, hepato-pancreatico-biliary, genito-urinary and gyne-oncological cancers, as well as rare tumours such as neuroendocrine tumours. We are also home to the Temerty Breast Centre and the Susan Leslie Clinic for Neuroendocrine Cancers. These services are offered in partnership with all Ontario regions, but particularly in the north-east Greater Toronto Area (GTA). The centre has also innovated with highly specialized radiation treatments, including the Cancer Ablation Therapy program (CAT) that comprises Canada’s first MRI-LINAC, Canada’s only MRI-brachytherapy operating room, and a Gamma Knife ICON. Our Surgical Oncology program is a high quality and high volume program that has focused on health services research, clinical trials as well as innovative technological advances (example: Magnetic seed localization). Comprehensive general cancer care is also delivered with a priority to the local catchment area in the north Toronto community. Outpatient care is delivered through the Odette Cancer Centre. In 2022/23, the cancer program delivered over 40,000 systemic treatments, over 76,000 radiation treatments, and 3,000 complex cancer surgeries. A major focus of development over the next five years is to accelerate the growth of our personalized oncology program including expansion of our early phase clinical trial portfolio and development of cell-based therapies.

Candidates must hold an MD degree, have certification from the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada (or equivalent qualifications), be eligible for licensure with the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario and be qualified to hold a clinical full time academic appointment at the University of Toronto at the rank of Associate Professor or Full Professor in an appropriate clinical department. The successful candidate will be a transformational leader with outstanding interpersonal skills. The candidate will have the vision to advance integration with Sunnybrook strategic priorities as well as with the broader community; commitment to forging partnerships with other institutions, community agencies and our North Toronto OHT to support the development of integrated delivery systems; experience working in diverse populations; will value inclusiveness, equity and diversity, and nurturing an ethos of culturally-sensitive care; will have strong leadership capabilities, commitment to inter-professional and family integrated care, significant experience as an effective and generous mentor to trainees and faculty at all stages of their careers; a record of peer-reviewed research; leadership in undergraduate, postgraduate, fellowship, continuing medical education or patient education; and/or leadership in model service delivery as a creative professional academic activity.

The Regional Vice President (RVP) plays an integral role in the coordination of cancer care across Ontario by acting in a dual role jointly accountable to the President & CEO of Ontario Health (Cancer Care Ontario) and the President & CEO of Sunnybrook (or their assigned designates). A principle of this dual relationship is to be complementary, and therefore support provincial, regional, and organizational planning. Through leadership at Ontario Health (Cancer Care Ontario) and the Regional Cancer Program, the RVP is responsible for executing at the provincial and regional level the vision, mission, and goals of Ontario Health (Cancer Care Ontario) and of Sunnybrook. The RVP is responsible for championing and influencing system transformation to drive performance of the cancer system and the region.

As a premier academic health sciences centre, Sunnybrook is committed to high quality inter-professional education. It provides unique educational experiences for more than 4,000 trainees each year and is the home of one of the University’s four Academies for undergraduate medical education, in addition to providing superb postgraduate and fellowship training in virtually all disciplines.

Sunnybrook Research Institute (SRI) is the research arm of Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre and has internationally acclaimed programs in basic and applied research. SRI scientists work to understand and prevent disease, and to develop treatments that enhance and extend life. Each year, SRI conducts about $100 million in research developing innovations in care for the more than 1.3 million patients. For more information about SRI, please visit www.sunnybrook.ca/research.

The Odette Cancer Program produces high quality research across platforms. Between 35-43 million dollars of grant funding is awarded annually to researchers, many with national and international reputations. Since 2014 the number of active clinical trials has risen with 400 clinical trials currently active and renewed infrastructure funding through 3 CTN (Canadian Cancer Clinical Trials Network).

Philanthropy is an essential enabler of our vision to Invent the Future of Health Care. The Chief of the Odette Cancer Program will work in close partnership with the Sunnybrook Foundation to identify key philanthropic priorities, and to engage with potential donors to advance these priorities and make them a reality.

Applications will be accepted until November 20, 2023, however, the position will remain open until filled or recruitment is closed. Review of applications will begin immediately. Interested candidates must submit (1) letter of interest, (2) statement on contributions to equity, diversity and inclusion (EDI) [300-words maximum], (3) up-to-date curriculum vitae and (4) names and contact information of three referees. Examples of contributions to EDI include faculty and/or leadership development initiatives; development of inclusive pedagogies; research, scholarship and/or teaching with a focus on underrepresented and historically marginalized communities; public engagement activities that reach out to marginalized communities; mentoring of students, staff and/or faculty from underrepresented groups.

Application package should be submitted to:

Don Lang, Chair, Search Committee, c/o Ms. Rajni Sandhu, Office of Medical Professional Practice, Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre, 2075 Bayview Avenue, Room DG29, Toronto, Ontario, M4N 3M5 Canada. Email: rajni.sandhu@sunnybrook.ca

CAUTION: This ad is “posted only” to the U of T affiliated hospital job board. Please see the information directly above for the application instructions; applications submitted via the "Apply Now" button on this page will NOT be considered for this position

jobs.title: Senior Report Developer
jobs.description:
Senior Report Developer

Enforcement Branch

Business Analytics & Solutions Unit

Permanent, Full-time

The Ontario Securities Commission (OSC) is the statutory body responsible for regulating Ontario’s capital markets in accordance with the mandate established in the provincial Securities Act and the Commodity Futures Act. The mandate of the OSC is to provide protection to investors from unfair, improper or fraudulent practices, to foster fair, efficient and competitive capital markets and confidence in the capital markets, to foster capital formation, and to contribute to the stability of the financial system and the reduction of systemic risk. This mandate is performed through policy, operational, adjudication and enforcement work. The OSC also contributes to national and global securities regulation development.

We offer a diverse, fair, and flexible work environment and take pride in our challenging and rewarding work.

The Enforcement Branch supports the OSC in delivering fair... vigorous and timely enforcement. The Enforcement Branch investigates and litigates breaches of securities laws in Ontario. Staff works closely with other securities regulators, self-regulatory organizations and law-enforcement agencies to enhance initiatives to fight misconduct. A strong enforcement presence assists in protecting investors from unfair, improper or fraudulent practices and fostering fair and efficient markets.

The Business Analytics and Solutions Unit of the Enforcement Branch is currently recruiting for a Senior Report Developer will play a key leadership role in profiling the activities of the Enforcement Branch by reporting on the success and impact of branch core activities of detecting, investigating and prosecuting misconduct in the marketplace. In addition to measuring progress on existing goals, the compiled and analyzed data will assist management in developing future strategy and goals for the branch.

What will you do?

Operational Branch Reporting
• Act as the point of contact or lead resource for information related to report development, data management, and data analytics including the research and resolution of any issues, determining solutions, developing and preparing reports as well as presenting results.
• Work with a variety of stakeholders to initially define business requirements, identify available data assets, and iteratively build compelling and highly usable dashboards and reports that will allow the business stakeholders to consume data in an intuitive manner, and execute on business decisions.
• Build and leverage reporting that utilizes data pipelines to provide actionable insights into regulatory activities, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics.
• Establish strong understanding of data entities, and their contextual relationship with business needs.
• Responsible for drafting and maintaining procedural documentation to ensure continuity and consistency of work product.
• Interpret information related to Enforcement operations, analyze data, present and report issues, findings and trends that impact on the work of the Branch.
• Develop, maintain, analyze and report on key Enforcement operational performance indicators to reflect how the branch is meeting its mandate (e.g. for use in quarterly reports).
• Proactively identify new data points and data requirements, maintain and analyze which is conducive to the efficient and effective operation of the Enforcement Branch and develop strategic KPIs for the branch.
• Accountable for strong data gathering and analytics, proactively identifying trends and issues, providing solutions.
• Proactively identify and consolidate data to support branch initiatives and goals to help management make evidence-based decisions.
• Design new reporting to promote cohesion between Enforcement and other branches; work to increase visibility on referral projects and ensure accuracy on sanctions and collections processes.
• Lead and direct data projects; proactively communicate with senior management of both the Enforcement Branch and the OSC to understand, interpret and deliver on unique and complex projects.
• Participate in data governance and management meetings to highlight Enforcement branch needs and ensure proper data management and controlled exposure of data assets.
• Draw on extensive knowledge of Enforcement systems, analytics practices and databases and act as a resource for the branch and OSC.

Systems, Database and Tools
• Develop and maintain branch-wide management information systems, databases, business intelligence tools while identifying opportunities to increase efficiencies while strengthening data integrity.
• Identify system updates, upgrades; responsible for implementation plan including conducting performance testing of systems, rolling out with pilot group prior to broader user community, training, and communicating changes to users

Branch Reporting Improvement & Maintenance
• Liaise effectively with BAS team members, Senior and Executive Management on opportunities to improve reporting standards, data governance, and work with them to recommend credible and feasible methods for improvement.
• Work with internal and external stakeholders to develop reporting best practices at the OSC.
• Facilitate adherence to set report standards and guidelines and ensure that reports that are of certain quality.
• Proactively obtain feedback from the end users and address as needed.
• Research and recommend metrics and processes to Lead/wider team to ensure consistency with industry best practices, and implementation of a perpetual improvement model.

What do you need to succeed?
• Undergraduate degree in programs, including Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Business or other related discipline.
• 5+ years of relevant experience in Business Intelligence and Reporting.
• Operational experience in working with a variety of business data sets, and deriving valuable key performance indicators (KPIs)/Metrics.
• Experience and in Data Warehousing, ETL, Data Management, Cloud Environments would be an asset.
• Advanced proficiency and experience working with data (structured and unstructured) business intelligence, analytics and reporting tools, such as: Crystal reports, Cognos, Tableau, PowerBI, Python, Mircrosoft Azure or other SQL platforms.
• Familiarity with Microsoft Azure Synapse analytics is an asset.
• Successful completion of Python, R Tableau and/or Cognos courses and certification an asset
• Experience with analyzing large volumes of data from a variety of sources and formulate data into simple, complete and concise qualitative and quantitative formats.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate important information with attention to detail, accuracy and confidentiality.
• Excellent presentation skills, problem solving and strategic thinking skills.
• Clear and concise verbal and written communication skills.
• Demonstrated tact and negotiating skills when dealing with diverse parties.
• Demonstrated ability to provide strong mentorship and coaching to junior / support staff.
• Knowledge or experience in the securities industry.

Note: This role is eligible for hybrid work and as per OSC's hybrid policy requires a minimum of 3 days/week working from the office at 20 Queen Street West in Toronto.

Apply online by November 17, 2023 at 11:59 pm EST/EDT by visiting our careers page at https://www.osc.ca/en/about-us/careers-osc.

Grow your career and make a difference working at the OSC.
• OSC Employees, please apply in Workday using the OSC Internal Jobs Report in your Jobs Hub*

We thank all applicants for their interest in the Ontario Securities Commission. We will contact those selected for an interview.

The OSC is committed to diversity and providing an inclusive workplace and providing accommodation in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Human Rights Code. It is our priority to ensure employment opportunities are visible and barrier-free to all under-represented groups including but not limited to, Indigenous, Black and racialized groups, people with disabilities, women and people from the LGBTQ2S community, to achieve an employee demographic profile reflective of the demographic profile of Ontarians.

The OSC is a proud partner with the following organizations: BlackNorth Initiative, Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion, and Pride at Work Canada.

If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting our confidential inbox HRRecruitment@osc.gov.on.ca.

Visit Accessibility at the OSC to review the OSC’s policies on accessibility and accommodation in the workplace.

Why work here?

At the Ontario Securities Commission (OSC), we carry-out challenging and meaningful work within a collaborative culture to deliver strong investor protection and foster confidence in capital markets. Evolving financial markets mean new ways of thinking, and every day is an opportunity to learn, innovate and grow professionally in a supportive, stimulating workplace

jobs.title: Spirit of English Teacher - Grade 4 - 0.25 FTE
jobs.description:
About Spirit of English:

Spirit of English is an exciting Canadian phenomenon in education, offering above-average students an opportunity to stretch their understanding of English with others like them in an after-school setting.

Job Description:

Spirit of English is seeking a teacher who enjoys the art of language, likes to share their passion of working with kids, and has a desire to stretch themselves. This is not a tutoring position, but a teaching position for classes of highly motivated and exceptional students. Teachers selected to teach with Spirit of English Validation classes are provided with training before they begin, as well as ongoing training and feedback sessions throughout the year.

The ideal candidate is patient, gregarious, and highly dependable. You excel at connecting with children by providing a balance of kindness and firmness. You understand the importance of providing children with a structured environment that will facilitate their learning. You will be... challenged to help students discover the conceptual building blocks which make up English. You are skilled at making others feel valued and included. You are a team worker who has an innate desire to help others develop. In addition to possessing the above traits, you have an eagerness to help refine the Spirit of English program in its validation stage before it is fully launched. The training you will receive as a Spirit of English teacher will deepen your understanding of the language and stretch your abilities as a teacher.

Educational Requirements:

Has a degree from a recognized college or university is necessary. A Bachelor of Education or English is an asset, but not mandatory.

Responsibilities

The teacher fosters a collaborative and welcoming learning environment, develops the English skills of students and builds strong relationships with parents. The Teacher will be responsible for the following:

a) Effectively managing the classroom to maintain a safe, orderly learning environment

b) Adhering to the Spirit of English teaching methodology and administrative system

c) Delivering lessons to students

d) Grading students assignments, tests and exams

e) Building and maintaining relationships with parents

f) Addressing issues with students’ performance and behaviour

g) Drafting report cards comments three times per year

h) Managing assistant teachers as needed

i) Maintaining an up-to-date and accurate records of grades and attendance

j) Attending training sessions every one to two months

k) Meeting with the Innovation Department weekly

l) Providing valuable, insightful feedback on how to improve the curriculum

m) Document and fixing curriculum edits as needed

To promote cooperation, inspire confidence, and release the genius in every child.

Spirit of Math is an equal opportunity employer and adheres to equitable hiring, employment and promotion practices. The positions are open to all qualified applicants, including men, women, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, Aboriginal persons and other groups protected by human rights laws. We strive to meet the accommodation needs of persons with disabilities. Applicants are encouraged to make their needs for accommodation known in advance during the application process

jobs.title: Sr. Systems Engineer (C/C++, Linux, WebGL)
jobs.description:
Parallelz is building a new technology platform that enables new ways of delivering, discovering, and extending mobile applications - ways that were never thought possible. We enable developers (with no modifications to their code) to transform existing mobile apps into web-native apps that can run anywhere, all without a walled-garden app store.

But this technology doesn't just magically appear, that's where you come in. You will help us build breakthrough technology to enable a radically improved mobile experience for users that give them more control over their mobile device experience. You will be getting in right at the beginning, working with the team to take our early versions of the technology to market, and turning it into a product that will have an impact across the industry.

Parallelz founding team and advisors are serial entrepreneurs and technologists from Google, Mozilla, Microsoft, MIT Media Labs, Nvidia, and other top organizations. The company is joined by top tier... and global venture funds and angel investors.

Requirements

Are you the right person for the job? This is a technically demanding role that will require a lot of creative problem solving and out-of-the-box thinking. A great candidate has:
• 5+ years experience with C/C++
• A bit of experience with Rust, Java, or Python wouldn't hurt
• Deep experience developing for Android/Linux (Android Internals, AOSP)
• Experience with one or more of network (socket) programming, WebGL, or Linux device driver programming
• In addition to the ability to work at the level of the OS on Android/Linux, these technologies are highly desirable:
• LXC containers, OpenGL ES, WASM, WebGPU, WebRTC, AWS
• A data-driven mindset - you rely heavily on qualitative and quantitative data to make informed decisions
• A ‘dig into a problem until it bleeds' attitude – you want to know how every part of the system works in detail
• Bonus marks for:
• An interest in Machine Learning & AI and other emerging technologies
• Graduate work and/or research background in a related area

Benefits

This is a full-time, fully remote position. We offer a competitive salary, benefits, and an Employee Stock Option Plan

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer (5+ years)
jobs.description:
Foresight Analytics is changing auto insurance by applying Autonomous Vehicle technology to driving analysis. We take a data-driven approach, made unique by computer vision solutions inside each vehicle.

This approach enables auto insurance to stay relevant in the coming era of self-driving cars.

We have a tall tech stack, broken down into two broad areas.

We'd like for you to have mastery of at least one of these two broad areas, and be interested in learning to work with and on the other.

1) In-car device software measures and reports on driving in real-time.

Computer is an NVIDIA Nano.

Software is written in Rust.

GStreamer is used to pipe video from cameras into machine learning models.

Machine learning models are ported from research environment to run with CUDA and TensorRT (some C++ is involved).

2) Vehicles reports observations to a central server that also serves a portal website for users.

Server is written with Node.js, Express, and Sequelize.

Database is... Postgres.

Front end is written with Vue.js.

Some less specific technical skills are important to us:

Familiarity with Git -- rebasing should be useful to you, not voodoo.

Familiarity with Docker, DigitalOcean (or similar), and managing running software in general.

We need you to have a "senior presence" in the team. What that means to us:

You can fill-in-the-gap and help others do the same.

You are a strong communicator and you can help others become stronger communicators.

You identify and address when a problem becomes a pattern.

You know how to tread the line between doing what was tasked and what will have the most impact.

You can architect a good solution, including social integration of the idea.

You know when to use documentation, testing, and QA to achieve a high standard of quality.

You can review code and make it a learning opportunity for the author.

You're a good judge of when more or less software development processes are needed.

In terms of experience, we estimate five years in a similar position is needed to have the context we want you to contribute.

X-Matik focuses on Automotive, Machine Learning, Connected Cars, and Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning. Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, X-Matik has raised $1.15M of funding; their latest round was closed on August 2019 at a valuation of $10M.

You can view their website at https://www.x-matik.com

jobs.title: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
jobs.description:
Job Type: VP and Above

Location: Ontario

Industry: Business Services

Job Number: 253816

Job Manager: Kelsey Robinson

Toronto

Competitive

We are currently working with the Toronto Region Board of Trade (The Board), which is an established, 200 year old organization with over 10,000+ members. They are the largest and most influential business network company in North America, and they have been a key stone in advising organizations during this difficult time.

Reporting directly to the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO), this position will lead the development and implementation of The Board's membership & partnership and revenue and engagement strategy. The role is responsible for the Board’s sponsorable asset inventory, working with internal teams to identify opportunities to deliver value to key partners and stakeholders. As well, the role oversees the member acquisition and retention strategy, as well as our member experience.

The successful candidate is entrepreneurial... creative, and passionate about connecting the Toronto region business community.

Your Responsibilities:
• Sales Leadership:
• Works with CCO to develop and implement a sales strategy that aligns with the overall business goals and objectives to drive revenue growth by increasing market share and driving new business development opportunities.
• Responsible for full-cycle member and partner acquisition, including prospecting, pitching, nurturing and reporting of potential opportunities
• Responsible for sponsorable asset inventory and identifying additional partnership opportunities
• Monitor and analyze market trends and customer needs to identify sales opportunities.
• Build and maintain relationships with key clients, industry partners, and vendors.
• Develop and maintain sales forecasts and budgets, and analyze sales data to ensure goals are met.
• Develop and present sales reports to executive leadership team, highlighting key successes and challenges, and proposing solutions to achieve targets.
• Ability to develop compelling proposals for a c-suite and top executive audience
• Attend Board events, industry events, conferences, and trade shows in order to promote the company and develop new relationships.
• Operational Leadership:
• Manage and mentor the sales team of 2 direct reports and total team size of ~10 membership and partnership team members, setting performance targets, coaching sales professionals, and assessing performance.
• Collaborate with other executives and key departments (marketing, finance, operations) to develop integrated plans that align with the sales strategy.
• Oversees member and partner internal CRM strategy

Your Experience:
• University degree with a preference for candidates with Business Management, Marketing or like-specialties
• 15 to 20 years of experience in Partnerships, Business Development, and/or Sales, with experience in a B2B environment
• 10 to 15 years of experience managing a team with proven leadership and people development skills
• Demonstrated ability to lead strategy development, execution and professional reporting in a partnership, business development, or sales capacity
• Superior writing ability with proven experience developing compelling and professional client proposals
• Effective project and time management capabilities and exceptional organizational skills, with proven ability to meet strict and competing deadlines for multiple projects in a fast-paced environment

You’re often described as:
• A persuasive communicator and detail-oriented leader, with the ability to present strategies and plans with an evidenced-based approach to obtain buy-in from Executives
• Highly entrepreneurial, consistently looking to "raise the bar"
• An ambassador who is passionate about the work you do and the organization you work for
• An energetic and nimble self-starter with the ability to work independently and with teams
• Client-focused, open to incorporating others' ideas and accepting constructive criticism
• Open to changing directions, adopting new practices, or learning something new
• Diplomatic, tactful, and poised about complex issues
• Empathetic and adept with interpersonal dynamics

About the Toronto Region Board of Trade

At the Toronto Region Board of Trade, you work closely with a collaborative, results-driven team of city builders. You will be center stage on the issues that matter to the region. Working at the Toronto Region Board of Trade gives you an opportunity to work with thought leaders while collaborating with our dynamic, diverse membership.

Our culture is grounded in core values that include:
• Accountability – We are accountable to our Members, stakeholders, and each other.
• Collaboration – We are our strongest when we work together.
• Connections – We engage and build communities.

Learn more about the exciting work the Board is doing at bot.com.

We look forward to hearing from interested candidates. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

The Board welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

jobs.title: Media Lounge Attendant
jobs.description:
Company Description

At Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Partnership (MLSE), we are committed to creating an inclusive workplace that is representative of our community and where all employees feel they belong and can reach their full potential. We are Canada’s preeminent leader in delivering top quality sport and entertainment experiences and one of North America’s leading providers of exceptional fan experiences. We are the parent company of the National Hockey League’s Toronto Maple Leafs, the National Basketball Association’s Toronto Raptors, Major League Soccer’s Toronto FC, the Canadian Football League’s Toronto Argonauts and development teams with the Toronto Marlies (American Hockey League), Raptors 905 (NBA G League), Toronto FC II (MLS NEXT Pro League) and Raptors Uprising Gaming Club, the Toronto Raptors Esports franchise in the NBA 2K League.

MLSE owns and/or operates all the venues our teams play and train in, including Scotiabank Arena, BMO Field, Coca-Cola Coliseum... Ford Performance Centre, BMO Training Ground, and OVO Athletic Centre. We also provide fans in Toronto with incredible live music and entertainment events, as well as exceptional culinary experiences through our restaurants (e11even and RS) and clubs (Hot Stove Club, ScotiaClub and Platinum Club). Through MLSE Foundation, we have invested more than $45 million into Ontario communities since 2009 and with MLSE LaunchPad, we provide a place where youth facing barriers use sport to recognize and reach their potential.

We achieve all of this through our Common Purpose - to unite and empower our employees to create extraordinary moments for our fans and each other. Come be a part of the team.

Job Description

As a valuable member of the Catering team, you will be responsible for the delivery of championship customer service to fans and media personnel during Leafs and Raptors games.

Responsibilities
• Arrive in full uniform on time as per the schedule
• Prepare Media Lounge for food and beverage service
• Organize and stock product delivered for event day
• Provide a warm and welcoming atmosphere, greeting guests upon sign-in and receiving payment from guests for media meals
• Maintain and take ownership of the cleanliness of the lounge throughout the event
• Rotate food and beverage to maintain temperature and freshness
• Ensure the various deliveries throughout the event are done accurately and in a timely fashion
• Complete order requisition following each event
• Act as an ambassador to all Lounge guests, including media and MLSE management
• Communicate any special requests/menu requests to the Catering Supervisor
• Other administrative or service functions as the need arises
• Adhere to all MLSE service standards and policies including Health & Safety
• Work in compliance with the provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act

Qualifications

Note: Before reviewing the qualifications listed below, we want you to know that we understand you may not meet all the qualifications described and have other relevant expertise and experience. We invite you to please share this with us in the "Message to the Hiring Manager" section of our online application.
• Must be available to work evenings, weekends and holidays as required
• Ensure outstanding customer service and food quality satisfaction
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Work well under pressure; handle multiple tasks simultaneously
• Smart Serve certification
• A winning attitude

Additional Information

Apply by: November 20, 2023

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Partnership will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process. If you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email accommodations@mlse.com. Please note this email is only for accommodation requests. Resumes sent to this email address will not be considered
