jobs.title: Sales Trainer
jobs.description:
Over 80,000 businesses and millions of people use 1Password to protect their most important information. We’re a kind, curious, and customer-focused team on a mission to build the world's most-loved password manager and give people more control over their data.

As a member of 1Password’s Sales Enablement team, you will help contribute to the technology, processes, and content that empower sales teams to sell efficiently and at a higher velocity.

As a Sales Trainer, you will be responsible to ensure that 1Password’s internal go-to-market and channel partner sales staff across the globe possess the skills and knowledge to provide a high-quality buying experience for 1Password customers. You will need to iterate on 1Password’s current onboarding calendar, content, and training schedule to support new hires, current sales staff, and partners on an ongoing basis.

This is a Remote opportunity within Canada.

What we’re looking for:
• 3-5 years with training/incentive programs, learning... and development, and/or engagement/advocacy strategies
• Knowledge of adult learning principles and/or sales skills
• Phenomenal communication and presentation skills
• Strong analytical skills
• Project/program management experience
• Ability to develop strategic training plans to support the business needs
• Experience with 1Password is an asset

What you can expect:
• Develop a strategic training plan for 1Password with the goal of developing highly knowledgeable advocates who enhance the experience for 1Password customers
• Help to develop e-learning activities and sessions based on 1Password training guidelines and business priorities set with external and internal partners
• Dedicated collaboration with sales leadership and 1Password internal teams to understand business priorities and recommend appropriate training strategies to support attainment of business goals and development of sales teams and channels
• Build close relationships with each partner’s training organization to ensure maximum impact on the sales staff
• Measure and evaluate success of training programs; modifying as required to increase impact.

1Password focuses on Enterprise Software, Security, and Productivity Software. Their company has offices in Toronto and Remote. They have a large team that's between 201-500 employees.

You can view their website at https://1password.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

jobs.title: C-suite Innovation Lead - Canada
jobs.description:
Role: C-suite Innovation Lead - Canada

Reports to: Managing Director, Canada

Location: Toronto, Canada

Overview

MiQ is a technology-driven programmatic media partner for marketers and agencies.

We take the “partner” part of that description very seriously and everything we do has our partners in mind.

As the Innovation lead, you will drive our tech ambitions in Canada. You will lead a team of diverse talents from solutions engineers to product managers all with one aim - delivering client solutions that delight our partners and drive outstanding business outcomes.

Responsibilities

This is a new role for us, and you’ll play a big part in shaping how some of the specific responsibilities evolve. With that, there are a number of things we know we’ll want you to take the lead on:
• Establishing the vision and roadmap for our product and solutions offerings in Canada
• Leading a multi-talented team of individuals; motivating, engaging and challenging the team to deliver outstanding... products and solutions.
• Hold global product teams accountable to deliverables that empower the CA business with product and solutions.
• As part of the senior leadership team, helping shape our overall product and solutions strategy connecting with commercial opportunity and operational considerations.
• Acting as a figurehead within our business for what Leadership excellence looks like exhibiting the culture and behaviours that will continue to drive this business forward.

Things you should know
• This role reports to the Managing Director and is part of our Senior Leadership Team In Canada
• The specific title of this position is open to discussion
• While we are still figuring out what the future of work will look like exactly for us in 2023 and beyond, we do want the person in this role to be able to meet with folks in our Toronto office when required, so location-wise GTA will work best
• MiQ is a global company with a Centre of Excellence located in India. As part of your role you will work a lot with folks all over the globe as well as across Canada.

What will make you successful in this role
• This is a role for a technology and product leader who has had lots of experience in the programmatic space. We are a complicated business and leading this team successfully will require deep industry knowledge.
• The ability to facilitate learnings across your direct team (and wider business) on technical matters as well as how to lead.
• Being an empathetic leader who sets high expectations and coaches their teams to new levels of achievement and growth.
• Staying commercially minded at all times is key for anyone in our business, but especially when leading our Innovation ambitions.
• A proven track record of launching technology and product solutions that deliver strong commercial results.

We are hugely excited to be adding this role to our leadership team - it’s an exciting time at MiQ!

BENEFITS & PERKS
• Competitive compensation that includes bonus and profit share
• No co-pay benefits from day 1 (single or family)- medical, dental, vision
• 25 vacation days
• Two extra paid days of Inclusion Leave per year to acknowledge and celebrate cultural holidays, community endeavours, and inclusive initiatives that are meaningful to our employees beyond the standard holidays.
• Six months paid parental leave
• RRSP matching contribution plan
• Wellness benefits including free access to benefits provider Cyno
• Awesome opportunities for growth
• Flexible work environment with both remote and in office attendance and fun team building activities
• Two weeks virtual orientation to learn about our business and meet the broader team upon joining MiQ

jobs.title: Senior Gameplay Programmer
jobs.description:
Bad Brain Game Studios is a brand-new game studio on a mission to create a new, story-driven franchise based on an open world action-adventure game built in Unreal Engine 5.

We have offices in Toronto and Montreal and are hiring for several roles in a hybrid work environment. So if you hold gaming close to your heart and wish to embark on a new adventure, #FreeYourBrain and join us to create unforgettable experiences that challenge minds and inspire imaginations.

About the Role:

As a Senior Gameplay Programmer, you will be responsible for creating, maintaining and supporting major gameplay systems with an impact on the whole game. You will be working closely with other Engineers, Designers and other disciplines.

You will be expected to have high standards and help the more junior members of the team develop their skills through reviews, training, encouragement and constructive feedback.

Location: Toronto, ON or Montreal, QC

Responsibilities:
• Work with game designers, content... creators (animators, …) and programmers to design and create high quality gameplay systems that allow for rapid iteration.
• Break down, estimate and coordinate large tasks, and clearly update your progress.
• Test, debug, profile, and optimize a wide range of code, both familiar and unfamiliar.
• Mentor more junior programmers.
• Communicate with designers, artists and other engineers to ensure the gameplay satisfies production needs and quality standards.
• Contribute to and propagate good coding standards.
• Write maintainable and robust code.
• Iterate on features rapidly, and apply techniques to maintain flexibility in expanding codebases.
• Be an active part of a team creating the highest quality of gameplay experience.
• Above all else produce fun and engaging gameplay.

Qualifications:
• 8+ years of C++ programming experience in game development working in medium/large teams, with 5+ of them in gameplay.
• Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
• Excellent programming skills in C++.
• Ability to learn and master a large existing code base.
• Strong software engineering and debugging skills.
• Experience with mentoring other Programmers and providing insightful feedback on implementation.
• Experience in multi-platform/AAA game development.
• Experience in creating a variety of gameplay mechanics for AAA, third person, action games.
• Strong math skills, including geometry and vector math.
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze gameplay and code.
• Experience developing in Unreal Engine 5 is a plus.

Qualities Needed to Thrive in this Role:
• Good communication skills and ability to work on shared projects with designers, animators, artists, testers, and other developers.
• Ability to self-organize and be autonomous.
• Have a good understanding of how games work and the ability to break down how existing games achieve (or fail to achieve) their aims

jobs.title: Lecturer or Assistant / Associate / Full Professor - Academic...
jobs.via: via U Of T Jobs - University Of Toronto
jobs.description:
Date Posted: 11/08/2023

Closing Date: 12/15/2023, 11:59PM ET

Req ID: 34839

Job Category: Faculty - Clinical

Faculty/Division: Temerty Faculty of Medicine

Department: Dept of Medicine

Hospital Affiliation: University Health Network (UHN) & Sinai Health System (SHS)

Campus: St. George (Downtown Toronto)

Description:

The Department of Medicine, Temerty Faculty of Medicine at the University of Toronto, and the Division of Cardiology of the University Health Network (UHN) and Sinai Health System (SHS) are seeking to recruit a qualified full-time Clinical Academic Cardiologist with expertise in cardiovascular-critical care (cardiac intensivist). The successful candidate would fulfil the academic position description of Clinician Teacher (CT) and must be eligible for academic appointment at the minimum rank of Lecturer at the University of Toronto. The anticipated start date is July 1, 2024 or as mutually agreed upon.

The Cardiac Intensivist will be a part of a multi-disciplinary... team, and is responsible for a 14-bed Cardiac Intensive Care Unit. They will have completed a minimum of one-year of critical care fellowship. The successful candidate will have subspecialty training in cardiology and fellowship training in critical care and will be able to manage patients with critical and complex illness, taking a patient centered approach. The successful candidate will have demonstrated excellence and effective ability in interpersonal relationships, oral and written communication skills, organizational skills, priority and problem-solving skills, and conflict resolution.

The candidate would have experience in the management of advanced ventilatory support, renal replacement therapy, hemodynamic monitoring, percutaneous mechanical circulatory support devices (Impella, RVAD, LVAD, Protek Duo, and Tandem Heart), advanced heart failure patients, Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO) and heart transplant, as well as overflow post cardiac surgery patients.

The primary goal of this recruitment is to participate and enrich the educational experience in the critical care environment. The successful candidate will participate in the development and delivery of educational programs for medical trainees and interprofessional education in the UHN Cardiac Intensive Care Unit and the University of Toronto. The candidate will also oversee medical rotations for undergraduate and postgraduate trainees as well as clinical fellows. Responsibilities will also include providing clinical care in the outpatient settings, teaching, and participation in other scholarly activities. Teaching excellence will be assessed through learner evaluations, teaching awards, and depth and breadth of experiences in teaching at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels.

An educational and clinical focus in equity, inclusion and diversity is important. Expertise in virtual care, remote patient management, use of digital health tools to enable improved access to high quality care, in particular experience in health care delivery through team based care and regional access for cardiogenic shock and chronic disease is a requirement.

The successful candidate will report to the Division Director of Cardiology at UHN/SHS. Candidates must hold an MD degree or equivalent and should have, or be eligible for, certification in Cardiology by the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada and licensure with the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Ontario (CPSO). The primary language of work will be English. Compensation will depend on the amount of clinical work performed, (estimated based on fee for service billing) but will be in the usual range for an experienced academic Cardiologist in the Province of Ontario, commensurate with qualifications and experience. Additional sources of income from Alternate Funding Plans (AFPs) and merit awards from the Department of Medicine may be available. Health benefit options and plans are supplied per institutional policy. In addition, the candidate may be reimbursed partial start-up costs for office expenses.

Applications will be accepted until December 15th, 2023, or until the position is filled.Interested applicants should send a cover letter, a copy of their curriculum vitae and the name and contact information of three referees to:

Dr. Heather Ross

Director, Division of Cardiology, UHN/SHS

c/o Tiffany La

Email: tiffany.la@uhn.ca

For more information about the Department of Medicine at the University of Toronto, please visit our website at https://www.deptmedicine.utoronto.ca. The Department of Medicine’s academic position descriptions can be viewed on this webpage: https://www.deptmedicine.utoronto.ca/academic-position-descriptions.

CAUTION: This ad is “posted only” to the U of T affiliated hospital job board. Please seethe information directly aboveforthe application instructions; applications submitted via the "Apply Now" button on this page will NOT be consideredforthis position

jobs.title: Community Safety Team Member - Security/Community Outreach
jobs.description:
One Community Solutions CARES.

Compassion,
Adaptability,
Relationship Building,
Excellence,
Safety.

We at One Community Solutions provide a unique service which involves working with the vulnerable population currently made up of individuals who are battling homelessness, drug addictions and mental health. We build understanding and respect with the clients and staff to help create safe environments in and out of the shelters.

Our CST's (Community Safety Team) work 24 hours a day doing patrols in neighborhoods, cleaning up drug paraphernalia and also keeping watch at local schools (from daycares to high schools) to ensure the continued safety of children, teens and pets in the area.

As a member of One Community Solutions’ Team, you have the opportunity to make a difference in your local community - to be someone who
CARES.

Please note that we operate in all weather conditions and many of our sites are outdoors.

Essential duties for this position are as follows;
• Escorting and... providing assistance to One Community Solutions Clients at their work-site. The assistance provided could include, but isn’t limited to; providing assistance with meal service, collecting and distributing linens, cleaning and maintaining the property, etc.
• Routinely performing perimeter checks, wellness checks and environmental checks
• Ensuring access to worksite areas are being monitored and controlled.
• Responding to crisis situations and overdoses
• Patrol designated areas while collecting and clearing drug paraphernalia and responding to community calls for clean up
• Interact with local residents and businesses and serve as a community liaison
• Respond to community calls to address or remove vulnerable people on private property
• Provide any reasonable assistance to residents and shelter staff in a courteous and helpful manner
• Assisting with administrative tasks and other tasks as assigned

Qualifications for this position include;
• Prior experience working in a customer service-oriented environment
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Strong interpersonal skills and customer service skills which includes, but isn’t limited to, conflict resolution, decision making, situational assessments and problem solving.
• Valid Security Guard License is considered an asset
• Valid certificate in Standard First Aid and CPR level ‘C’ are considered an asset
• Knowledge of legislative policies such as the
Criminal Code
,
Trespass to Property Act
and
WHMIS
are considered an asset
• Ability to work shifts, weekends and holidays

How to Apply?

Our organization is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace. We exercise employment practices which are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). jobs.title: Sr. Manager Engineering Operations
jobs.description:
Achievers delivers an Employee Success Platform™ which dramatically increases employee engagement and drives business success. Designed specifically to meet the needs of today’s workplace, it empowers employees to recognize each other in real time and aligns them to the goals of the company. With more than 5,000,000 annual recognitions, the Platform inspires brilliant performance in 110 countries. Visit us at www.achievers.com to learn more and join us in our mission to change the way the world works.

We hire ambitious professionals who thrive on their entrepreneurial spirit and want to Change the Way the World Works. As Achievers employees, we are passionate about disruptive technology, we welcome constant change, and we understand the value of employee success in the workplace. We enjoy coming to work every day because we believe in our product and L.O.V.E. our culture. Achievers is more than just a software company; we are industry leaders in the H.R. space.

This role will have... three primary areas of responsibility and ownership: Global Engineering Operations, Coordination of Global Technical Support for the Achievers Platforms, and the Global/Value Lab’s Innovation and experimentation Team.

What you will do?

Reporting to the CTO, this role will lead a team of two to six individuals in:

Engineering Operations:

· Coordination of OKR

o Lead the coordination for all Engineering metrics for the Monthly Operating Reviews (MOR), Quarterly Board Meetings and all other ad-hoc reporting and presentations.

o Coach and coordinate the Quarterly and Annual OKR’s for the Engineering Organization

· Roadmaps

o Own the relationship between the Engineering organization and the Product Management Team and Group Project Manager

Work closely with the Project Management Office (PMO) on assigned key projects within the Engineering organization to deliver projects on time and within budget.Lead the process and coordinate general communication between the engineering organization and other groups within Achievers.

· Engineering Townhalls

o Ownership of Engineering Town Halls in partnership with CTO and Engineering Leadership team. This includes internal group content presenters and guest speakers.

· Engineering Headcount and Resourcing

o Owner of headcount planning for the Engineering Organization partnering with Talent Acquisition and Finance to ensure optimal staffing plans and roadmaps remain aligned and in lockstep, inclusive of contractors and Value Lab contractors

o Owner of onboarding and offboarding processes; refresh current onboarding and offboarding to sustainable programs.

o Owner of cooperative education/internship program and partner with Finance for tax credits

· Product Development – Weekly Review

o Coordinate and conduct the weekly cross grouped review.

o They are reporting on squad health, delivery metrics and issues.

· Engineering Agile Operations

o Working with our agile coach assist in applying Agile and Lean software tools and techniques (Scrum, Kanban, XP etc.) that are best suited to the teams and the problems they are working on.

· Engineering Dev X, a program of raising the Achievers engineering profile in GTA (Owner) (10%)

o Achievers is undertaking a program to raise the profile of the overall engineering Department within the greater Toronto area. As the owner of this initiative, you will be responsible for coordinating and executing speaking engagements blogs and YouTube videos about life at achievers.

o Areas of focus will be women in technology diversity and inclusion and our overall employee-centric culture.

· Engineering SRE&D

o Achievers' files a Government of Canada a government Ontario innovation tax credit every year. You will own this process from inside the engineering organization and establish procedures to ensure that work can be captured so that it can be reported upon.

o You will work closely with Finance to provide them with the T tails necessary to submit these claims.

Global Platform Technical Support Coordination

· Incident Management & Reporting

o Working closed with Engineering Leaders, the Technical Support Analysts and Customer Support, Triage and Prioritized defects and issues and ensure they are assigned to the appropriate Squad or Team with the Engineering organization.

o Working with the Engineer Managers to monitor, and revise as necessary, the incident escalation and communication process between the Engineering organization to the appropriate teams within Achievers.

o Participate in improving the team’s development practices in ensuring sustainability, security, and efficiency of the codebase.

· Change Control Board

o Achiever Platform Change Control Board meets on an as-required basis to review and approve or reject changes to the platform that may impact its stability and availability to our client base. You will chair this committee with a view to continuous improvement.

What You will Need?

· A technical background in web or software development, or otherwise a sophisticated understanding of product development and delivery in this context.

· Effective communication skills: a communication style that resonates with and inspires listeners, and effective use of Agile terminology to foster a collective understanding of these concepts.

· A firm belief in “people before process,” where the latter has value, but the former has more, emphasizes humanizing management techniques and the constant evaluation of whether processes truly support people and solve their problems.

· Experience using metrics/OKR’s to measure the impact of organizational change initiatives.

· A devotion to continuous self-improvement, a voracious appetite for learning new things, and a strong presence in the greater Agile community.

· A strong record of accomplishment in on-time value delivery.

· You have a promising idea of what “Great” looks like and a drive to lead your teams and influence the organization to achieve that ideal.

Achievers is committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner and will do so by preventing and removing barriers to accessibility and meeting accessibility requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

About Achievers:

As Achievers employees, we are passionate about disruptive technology, welcome constant change, and understand the value of employee success in the workplace. We enjoy coming to work every day because we believe in our product and love our culture. Achievers is more than just a software company; we are industry leaders in the HR space.

Our headquarters are conveniently located in Liberty Village, close to bars, shops and restaurants and are highly accessible by TTC and GO Transit.

We have been recognized in numerous publications for our contributions to HR, for technical excellence and for our outstanding workplace culture:

Achievers is ranked as number 32 on the list of Top 50 Best Workplaces in Canada.

Achievers has been recognized on the 2020 list of Best Workplaces™ for Women in Canada

Achievers has been recognized on the 2020 list of Best Workplaces™ for Inclusion

Achievers has been named one of the Top 10 Employee Recognition Solution Providers Globally

Check out our platform in action here

Achievers does not offer employment to prospects without first ensuring that qualified candidates speak directly with the hiring manager and a member of our HR team. All qualification will be done face-to-face, whether that is in person or over Zoom. Achievers does not send out offers of employment without meeting candidates and does not offer employment via text. If you are requested for any personal information via text and/or without having met a member of our hiring team in person, please disregard.

Our employees are a diverse and inclusive team of passionate, hardworking individuals. Achievers is committed to creating an environment where our employees can do the best work of their lives. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply to join our A-Player family. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Achievers focuses on Software and Incentives. Their company has offices in San Francisco. They have a large team that's between 201-500 employees. To date, Achievers has raised $43.2M of funding; their latest round was closed on September 2011.

You can view their website at http://www.achievers.com/ or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

jobs.title: Embedded c rtos engineer Toronto Canada ref
jobs.description:
Experience level: Mid-senior Experience required: 1 Years Education level: Bachelor’s degree Job function: Information Technology Industry: Semiconductors Compensation: View salary Total position: 1 Relocation assistance: Yes

Job Overview:

headquartered in San Jose, CA, is an industry leader in delivering programmable camera video processors to the rapidly growing automotive camera market. s products feature advanced image signal processing, unique eWARP® processing technology, and state of the art neural network-based computer vision solutions. GEO ships camera video processors in diverse automotive applications such as ADAS, autonomy, in-cabin monitoring, digital mirrors, smart backup and augmented reality cameras.

POSITION DETAILS:

Located at our Toronto, Canada facility, you will be part of GEO’s System Firmware team creating and bringing to market leading-edge image and video processing solutions for high performance current and next-generation ICs. You will have the... following responsibilities

Implement, test and document new system-level firmware features

Optimize system resources and video data path based on product use cases

Integrate new image and video processing capabilities (warping, computer vision) from algorithm teams

Develop, maintain camera control solutions over various interfaces (SPI, UART, CAN, Ethernet)

Interface GEO’s camera processor to various systems hosts, integrate with 3rd party middleware

Create and maintain tools for customers and developers

Help bring-up, debug customer systems and issues

QUALIFICATIONS:

BSc in computer science or electrical engineering

Strong C programming and debugging skills in RTOS environments

Experience with solving real-time embedded issues including threading, optimization, memory management, interrupt handling, etc.

Familiar with quality software development cycle

Knowledge of Python as a scripting language

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Skills that would help differentiate:

Experience working with Board Software Packages (BSPs)

Understanding of I2C, UART, SPI, graphics OpenVG/OpenGL and Ethernet protocols

Software development experiments in automotive or other safety-critical industries

Knowledge in various cryptographic authentications, hashing, encryption algorithms, secure key storage technologies

As a team member, you have a passion for quality, leading-edge, robust and reliable products. You are highly motivated, hands-on, technology savvy with excellent interpersonal skills. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative and deep technical environment

jobs.title: Executive Assistant to the C-Suite
jobs.description:
Our client is a leader in environmental and infrastructure projects in Canada. They currently require an individual who is comfortable working with their Chief Legal Officer and Head of Infrastructure in a fast-paced environment in Mid-Town Toronto. This role is most suited to a career Executive Assistant who enjoys a fast pace in a document focused department. Your love of all things administrative will allow you to be successful in this vital role in these beautiful offices.

Job Description

Our client is a leader in environmental and infrastructure projects in Canada. They currently require an individual who is comfortable working with their Chief Legal Officer and Head of Infrastructure in a fast-paced environment in Mid-Town Toronto. This role is most suited to a career Executive Assistant who enjoys a fast pace in a document focused department. Your love of all things administrative will allow you to be successful in this vital role.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Provide personal... support to the Chief Legal Officer and interact with a cross section of internal and external stakeholders
• Oversee email management and calendar with the highest levels of confidentiality
• Provide administrative assistance with document management and execution with high attention to detail

jobs.title: Platform Specialist (C)
jobs.description:
Startech Networks, Inc. is seeking experienced Platform Specialists with Canadian Work Authorization to work in the Bampton and Toronto areas of Ontario, Canada. Ideally, selected candidates will have the knowledge, skills and abilities to work with Nokia 7750-Routers and more as highlighted below. Nokia 7750-Router (preferred), experienced based knowledge and understanding of IP/MPLS networks and routing protocols (BGP, OSPF, ISIS), service architecture (EPL, EVPL, VPLS, L3VPN).

jobs.title: Property Accountant - Generalist
jobs.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

We are looking for a Property Accountant to join Oxford’s Accounting team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day accounting for various portfolios. This role requires strong attention to detail, communication skills and the ability to multitask in a complex environment. Experience... working in the real estate industry and large organization with a complex legal entity structure is an asset.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for
• Responsible for all aspects of general ledger accounting including preparing monthly journal entries, bank reconciliations, etc.
• Prepare reporting and analysis to joint venture partner, lenders and Corporate Accounting group. Prepare real estate tax, operating expense and other CAM (escalation billings) for tenants.
• Prepare statutory and audited financial statements for regulatory and lender reporting requirements
• Work proactively with the tax team and external advisors to ensure compliance with US REIT requirements
• Assist the Manager to ensure that the overall team monthly reporting is completed on time and accurately
• Work proactively with the Operations team to identify issues regarding the monthly financial results, reporting packages to clients, tenant escalation / tax questions, and provide guidance on proper accounting policies
• Participate in the monthly Operations / Accounting meetings on portfolio planning and the discussion and presentation of property results
• Work with the Asset Managers and other interested parties to coordinate the creation and flow of financial data, budgets and reforecasts
• Participate in the development, training, and implementation of new accounting policies, controls, and procedures
• Act as a systems and process support for Accounting and Operations
• Support and implement special project initiatives including documentation, process efficiencies, and implementation of system related improvements
• Work with independent auditors and create work papers to be used in conjunction with audits.
• Reviewing and analyzing tenant leases
• Other tasks and responsibilities as assigned in order to maintain accurate and efficient workflow and reporting
• Propose recommendations for process improvement of standardized reporting, policies and procedures to support efficiency and effectiveness of day to day activities

Experience/Qualifications Required
• University degree;
• CPA designation or substantially complete the CPA program
• Minimum 3 years’ experience in financial accounting
• Knowledge of real estate industry preferred
• Proven financial analytical skills
• Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and JDE expense is preferable.
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills
• Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environment
• Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt
• Drive to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinking

Our story

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys, and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$87 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences, hotels, alternatives and credit in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities, and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 80 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario's municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineering Manager, Data Services
jobs.description:
Ripple is looking for an engineering leader to help manage and guide the Data Infrastructure team to drive the company building scalable and self-serve Data infrastructure. As the Senior Software Engineering Manager, you will lead the effort to enable Ripple to democratize data by developing a self-serving data infrastructure.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:
• Manage and mentor a team of engineers responsible for designing, building, and operating our ever-growing data infrastructure
• Establish team objectives in alignment with business goals
• Work closely with engineering leaders to identify bottlenecks in our existing data infrastructure and guide the team in improving and scaling it; ensure that technical decisions support our quality, performance, scalability, reliability, availability, and security goals
• Support our analytics, data science, and ML teams
• Build systems and services that abstract the engines and will allow the users to focus on business and application logic via... higher-level programming models
• Improve and maintain data pipelines and tools to keep pace with the growth of our data and its consumers
• Identify and analyze requirements and use cases from multiple internal teams (including finance, compliance, analytics, data science, and engineering, ML); work with other technical leads to design solutions for the requirements.
• Mentor and guide the professional and technical development of your team; develop their careers by assigning them to projects tailored to their skills, personalities, work styles, and goals
• Instill a spirit of continuous improvement in the team’s code, architecture, and processes
• Work with your team and customers to sketch out the company’s vision for a data services architecture

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
• 10+ years of software infrastructure experience
• 3+ years as a people leader and a technical leader
• Deep experience with distributed systems, distributed data stores, data pipelines, and other tools in cloud services environments (e.g. AWS, GCP)
• Experience with building and managing API and Inbound data infrastructure for data Ingestion into the data lake
• A strong advocate of data governance and data quality
• Experience with big data tech stack Hadoop, Spark, Hudi, etc.
• Ability to make build versus buy decisions
• Experience with distributed event streaming platforms like Kafka, Flink, etc.
• Experience with database internals, database language theories, database design, SQL and database programming
• You have a passion for building and motivating teams to reach their potential
• You are a strong partner to other engineering and non-engineering teams and can drive cross-functional projects forward
• You have experience building internal infrastructure that is shared across teams
• Solid leadership and communication skills

NICE TO HAVE:
• Experience with AWS or Google cloud ecosystems
• Experience in building self-service data services
• Crypto domain experience or interest
• Familiarity with Kubernetes

WHAT WE OFFER:
• The chance to work in a fast-paced startup environment with experienced industry leaders
• A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact
• Competitive salary and equity
• 100% paid medical and dental and 95% paid vision insurance for employees starting on your first day
• 401k (with match), commuter benefits
• Industry-leading parental leave policies
• Generous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite programs
• Flexible vacation policy - work with your manager to take time off when you need it
• Employee giving match
• Modern office in San Francisco’s Financial District
• Fully-stocked kitchen with organic snacks, beverages, and coffee drinks
• Weekly company meeting - ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
• Team outings to sports games, happy hours, game nights and more!

Ripple focuses on Internet, Enterprise Software, Financial Services, Payments, and Banking. Their company has offices in New York City, San Francisco, Dubai, Singapore, and Washington DC. They have a large team that's between 501-1000 employees. To date, Ripple has raised $290.7M of funding; their latest round was closed on December 2019.

You can view their website at http://ripple.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Product Hunt

jobs.title: Business Development Representative

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Rust, C/C ++
jobs.description:
Job Title: Software Engineer - Rust, C/C++

Location: Canada (proximity to Toronto or Ottawa)

Company Overview:

Quantum Bridge is a Canadian startup company, specialising in delivering a scalable system for symmetric key distribution to enable quantum-safe encryption for everyone. We are a team of experts in our field, passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible, and always looking for talented individuals to join us in our mission.

Job Description:

We are looking for a Software Engineer with experience in system programming to join our team in Canada. Our primary programming language is Rust but candidates with strong C/C++ background willing to try a new language are welcome. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our DSKE products. You will work closely with our clients, project managers, and other team members to understand requirements, design solutions, and deliver high-quality code.

Responsibilities:
• Design, develop, and... maintain software systems using Rust.
• Collaborate with project managers, and other team members to understand requirements and design solutions.
• Write high-quality code that is testable, efficient, reliable, and maintainable.
• Debug and troubleshoot complex software issues.
• Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to team members.
• Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in software engineering.
• Document code, designs, and processes.

Requirements:
• You must have authorization to legally work in Canada.
• You must be located within reasonable travel distance from Toronto or Ottawa.
• You must be able to attend the job interview in person.
• You must meet the qualifications below.

Qualifications
• Ability to learn complex concepts quickly.
• Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering or a related field.
• At least 3 years of experience in software development, with a focus on system programming using Rust and/or C/C++.
• Understanding of basic cryptographic concepts like symmetric and asymmetric encryption, PKI, chain of trust, etc.
• Experience with development of REST API with Swagger/OpenAPI.
• Experience with development of gRPC APIs.
• Experience with Linux systems programming and debugging tools.
• Experience with version control systems, such as Git.
• Good communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

How to Apply
• Please send us a one-paragraph cover letter with 3-5 bullet points outlining any extraordinary abilities and/or most remarkable achievements.
• Please attach your most recent resume.
• Applications without the cover letter will be automatically rejected.
• You can also use this form to apply.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and welcome candidates from all backgrounds to apply. This is a contract position with a possibility of an extension.

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 3 months

Pay: $50.00-$75.00 per hour

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Application question(s):
• Where are you physically located?
• What phone number we can reach you at?
• What is your work authorization status in Canada?
• Is there anything else you would like to add?

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Toronto, ON

jobs.title: Technology Executive Assistant
jobs.description:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Technology Development Center in Toronto, Ontario, Canada (Tues - Thursday In-Office, Mon/Fri WFH - this is not a virtual / remote position)

Wayfair, the largest online-only retailer of home furnishings and housewares in the United States, has an immediate need for an Executive Assistant to manage the day-to-day activities for our Technology Leadership members. This is a fantastic opportunity for the right individual to support the senior leaders of one of the fastest-growing companies in Boston.

The ideal candidate will bring strong organizational and planning skills, detail orientation, a high sense of urgency, a sense of humor, and problem-solving abilities to the role. This person should be smart, engaging, fun, curious, and unflappable.

Wayfair’s team of Executive Assistants supports and manages the day-to-day activities for senior leaders across the organization. These activities include scheduling and... coordinating meetings, handling travel arrangements, performing personal tasks (such as errands, setting up appointments), and act as point person for visiting executives and large corporate investors. This is a unique opportunity for someone with Administrative experience to take their career to the next level.

Key Responsibilities
• Day-to-day administration and coordination of all areas of executive support
• Proactively manage calendars with the ability to schedule and prioritize meetings, resolve schedule conflicts, collaborate with other team members, and stay several steps ahead to maintain efficiency
• Provide EA Support of 1 - 3 Leaders
• Handle travel arrangements (int’l and domestic) and make frequent revisions as needed
• Schedule and coordinate numerous weekly and ad hoc meetings for executives
• Interact with key internal and external contacts, investors, and other C-level individuals in a professional manner
• Manage executives business expenses
• Collaborative partner on executive communications
• New Hire Onboarding Experience - serve as onsite point of contact for new hires, ensuring a seamless day 1-week 1 in-office experience
• Front Desk Engagement - greeting guests, letting people into the office [external and internal]
• AV Support - helping troubleshoot conference room technology [speakers, monitors, etc.] and partnership with IT Site Lead
• TDC (Tech Development Center) Engagement Activities - building a calendar, driving execution (in partnership with the Site Leader), managing the budget and social/volunteer committees
• Community Engagement - local volunteer opportunities
• General Administration - badging access partnership with Community Experience Site Lead, offsite support when executives are in town, ensure seamless site-specific processes and site-leadership support (visitor process, badging, events & engagement, seating etc.)
• Must be able to represent the team in a positive way to people outside the company
• Various other ad hoc cross-functional projects
• Act as back-up for other Admins

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree
• At least 3-4 years of experience as AA/EA for senior-level executives
• Ability to be assertive and give push-back as needed
• Meticulous attention to detail and strong planning and forward-thinking capabilities
• Demonstrated ability to anticipate needs and situations before they are fully developed
• Advanced proficiency in Google Enterprise Suite tools (calendar, mail drive, docs, sheets, slides, meet)
• Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills
• Extremely high level of discretion pertaining to confidential information
• Flexible and able to handle ad hoc issues that may arise outside of core business hours

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Wayfair, we don’t just accept differences - we celebrate it and support it. Wayfair is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Wayfair does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Ontario Disability Act

Wayfair complies with federal and provincial disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact the recruiter.

Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities

Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know by completing our Accomodations for Applicants form.

Need Assistance?

For more information about applying for a career at Wayfair, visit our FAQ page here.

About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. jobs.title: Group Strategy Director
jobs.description:
Our philosophy is simple: in a world fast approaching commoditization, our job is to make clients' brands unignorable. We believe creating unignorable brands begins with putting the consumer at the center of our thinking. We believe that people are smart and respond to brands that speak to them with intelligence, insight and purpose. Because when people don’t have to engage with your work anymore, you have to make them want to.

Job Description

Role: Group Strategy Director

We’re looking for someone with 10+ years of agency strategy experience and a proven track record of transformational, modern marketing work that has grown clients’ business. In collaboration with a cross disciplinary leadership team, the GSD will steward the direction of key pieces of businesses in the agency. You will provide business-relevant perspectives on communication challenges based on a thorough understanding of the market and competitive factors, helping to frame the overarching story of a project.

You... have a keen awareness of current trends in the industry and in culture and a proven track record for creating noteworthy insight that has been recognized in a meaningful way, both internally and by clients. You will ensure both the quality and soundness of the work from a strategy standpoint, as well as possess an affinity for creative and understanding of the essential business challenge behind every brief. Ultimately, your job is to ensure that the team and department is set up to deliver not only solutions, but also insight that helps clients make decisions about their businesses. This is a high visibility role, which requires outstanding influential, collaboration and communication skills. You will also mentor and manage more junior members of the strategy team.

Ideal candidates should be strategic leaders with the following skills and experience:
• A thought leader with 10+ years of strategic planning experience with a proven track record of transformational, modern marketing work that has grown clients’ business.
• Ability to influence C-Suite level clients.
• Brand builder, focused on the entire customer experience.
• Deep integrated communications planning experience with emphasis on digital environments.
• Ability to captivate an audience with a focus on strategic selling.
• Proficient in designing and facilitating creative problem-solving workshops.
• Expertise in multiple business strategy tools, frameworks, and methods.
• Proven builder of team expertise; supports development and shares best practices.
• Experienced in building communication strategies and annual plans.
• Strong reputation for relationships with creative, strategy, production, and account leaders and/or teams.
• A creative thinker, passionate about ideas.
• Proven ability to successfully design and facilitate large workshop activities to engage the client team in a creative problem-solving process.
• Strong creative vision with an understanding of business objectives and budgets.
• Excellent communication and confident presentation skills to explain ideas internally and persuade clients.
• Outstanding leadership, time management, and organization skills.

What you’ll do:
• Understand client businesses on a meaningful level in order to develop sound strategic insights in service of client business objectives.
• Drive the creative brief writing process.
• Lead strategic thinking on multiple projects in accordance with deadlines.
• Develop, manage, mentor and oversee strategy teams.
• Take high-level creative ideas and break them into their specific communications tasks; succinctly outline the role of channels within an idea; develop frameworks that assist in the presentation of ideas to clients.
• Anticipate and/or react to the needs of the brands.
• Establish and nurture strong working relationships.
• Act as a partner and sounding board during the creative process
• Keep up-to-date with trends in branding, marketing, and advertising.
• Create consumer connection profiles/maps that provide insight into consumer behaviors and relationships with relevant media, channels and non-traditional connection points
• Plan and facilitate integrated planning sessions and ideations both internally and/or with external participants
• Collaborate with cross-functional team to help lead and support new business pitches/opportunities.

We ask that all interested employees apply to this post with a CV and cover letter explaining your experience, and what makes you the ideal candidate. We encourage applicants who reflect the diversity of our city in terms of race, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, family/marital status, disability, socio-economic background, and ethnicity. If you fall into one or more of these groups, we welcome you to self-identify

jobs.title: Junior Project Coordinator
jobs.description:
Job description:

We are looking for motivated, self-starting, talented Junior Construction Project Coordinator and Administrative Assistant that will help the senior project managers with the back-office support. Applicants should have a dedication to learning, be able to manage time between different tasks and different projects as needed, be able to manage fast-paced work environments, manage large workloads, and be able to work well in a team or individually.

Primary responsibilities:

1) Procure Estimates from Various Trades

2) Complete estimates regarding the project and related costs.

jobs.title: Cyber Specialist
jobs.description:
Role (Specialist Type)/Service:

Cyber Specialist

Experience Level:

Senior

Estimated Start Date:

ASAP

Anticipated Duration:

6 Months

Duration of Potential Extension:

Yes

1.0 SkillsandCertifications

It is very important that the Services be undertaken by a Senior Security Specialist who can demonstrate specific knowledge of, and experience in performing similar work for projects of comparable nature, size and scope as detailed below.

· Extensive knowledge of enterprise architecture, architectural design and implementation methodologies including software, network and infrastructure.

· Knowledge of application design, system design, network design, and information security methods, standards, architectures, policies and procedures.

· Extensive knowledge and experience on cloud security and well versed with secure cloud migration/transformation methodologies

· Expertise in performing threat modeling exercise and security control design analysis

· Extensive experience... crafting security requirements and controls for new and existing solutions

· Proven understanding of the MITRE ATT&CK, NIST CSF, CSA CCM, PCI DSS, and CIS Critical Control frameworks

· Perform architecture and design reviews, coordinating with various stakeholders to integrate secure by design principles

· Engages with technology teams across the organization to build alignment on key projects and initiatives and develop strategy and cyber architecture execution roadmaps.

· Proficient in building and maintaining documented target security architectures, roadmaps, blueprints, patterns, and standards

· Strong working experience with the following security technologies: firewalls, Intrusion detection/prevention systems, endpoint security, vulnerability management, VPN, SASE, WAF, NAC, DLP, DDoS mitigation, SOAR, content filtering, cloud security gateways, secure proxies, crypto solutions, cloud protection etc.

· Assist in setting the cyber strategy and architecture standards for new developments within the City.

· Evaluates projects, systems, applications, network and tools for compliance to cyber and architecture standards.

· Create solutions that balance business requirements with information and cyber security requirements

· Excellent understanding of System Development Life Cycle, DevOps, Agile, Network administration

· Expert knowledge in Application Security (8+ years)

· Hands-On Experience conducting security risk assessment (10+years)

· Experience conducting application vulnerability assessment/penetration test (5+years)

· Current experience in Cloud Security and the evaluation/review/RFP of cloud based service such as Amazon Web Services, Salesforce in a public sector environment

· Experience working in the government/public sector (4+ years)

· Current experience in external contract/vendor RFP (both Cloud and on Premise): security requirements, evaluation, due diligence and review (5+ years)

· Strong understanding of common vulnerability frameworks (CVSS, OWASP Top 10).

· Professional designation in at least two of the following CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC and PMP

· Current Government Security Clearance

· Advanced knowledge of security standards such as ISO 27001/27002, NIST, ISO 27018, COBIT and Cloud security frameworks

2.0 AssignmentDuties

· Perform security review(s): Threat modeling exercise and security control design analysis, Threat Risk Assessments (TRA), vulnerability assessment, Cloud security assessment, technology review, application review, architecture review, project review, RFP evaluation

· Ability to develop in-house security risk assessment tools including the good software programming ability in languages such as VBA, Python, Java, or C

· Specify IT security products and processes.

· Direct the review, development, testing and implementation of Cyber Security plans, products and controls.

· Conduct research to aid in the security risk assessment of City operations, capital projects, and IT systems.

· Regularly review the enterprise for weaknesses in IT controls and procedures, and recommend measures to eliminate or mitigate same.

· Provide subject matter expert support/consultation to RFP design and evaluations, as directed.

· Provide strategic guidance regarding the appropriate use of new technologies (SaaS, BYOD, Cloud), the threat landscape and areas of potential concern.

· Maintain up-to-date, in-depth knowledge of cyber security and associated techniques and technologies, and disseminate this knowledge within the function and, where appropriate, within the wider IT team

· Clearly translate cyber security and information security challenges into business language and produce detailed risk assessment reports.

2iresourcing focuses on Deep Information Technology and Sap . Their company has offices in Toronto. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://2iresourcing.ca

jobs.title: Vice President, Global Markets Engineering (C#/WPF/React)
jobs.description:
Application Deadline:

11/13/2023

Address:
100 King Street West

BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service financial services provider. We offer corporate and investment banking, treasury management, as well as research and advisory services to clients around the world. #bmocapitalmarkets

BMO Capital Markets/Global Markets Engineering seeking a candidate with experience in the architecture, design, buildout and deployment of electronic trading systems, particularly in the Fixed Income space, preferably encompassing real-time risk/PnL processing and display, price contribution, customer inquiry negotiation and straight-through processes.

We seek an intermediate-to-experienced candidate: 5+ years experience/VP-level would be preferred.

Undergraduate/advanced degrees in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics (including Mathematical Finance) or Physics would be heavily valued.

Ideal candidate would have proficiency in:
• C++
• C#
• React/Javascript web... development

Note that an outstanding candidate could overcome a lack in one or more of the above proficiencies.

Responsibilities:
• Reporting to Director, responsible for the buildout of electronic bond trading for the Global Credit desks
• Filling in functionality gaps present in our existing electronic trading systems
• Ownership of the electronic trading components built, including production/realtime support
• Ongoing communication with trading and sales desks with respect to gaps, further functionality, prioritization and timelines

Nice to have:
• Knowledge of FIX protocol
• Experience with Windows Presentation Foundation
• Experience using OpenFin web/desktop integration
• Basic Python knowledge
• Real-time messaging
• Basic bond trading concepts, or the ability to pick them up quickly

“Soft” skills:
• Confer directly with trading desks on requirements, learning enough about the business (workflows, product types, etc.) to gain ability to infer requirements
• Able to accomplish component buildout in as independent a manner as possible
• Communication skills are paramount; successful candidate will be communicating with savvy but non-technical users and will need to be able to present findings and communications as such.

Grade:
7

Job Category:
Individual Contributor / Collaborateur

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter

jobs.title: Analyste, Soutien aux opérations
jobs.description:
Description De L'emploi

Niveau de poste: P5

Division: Service à la clientèle – Opérations

La Société financière IGM Inc. est l’une des principales sociétés diversifiées de gestion de patrimoine et d’actifs, et gère un actif total d’environ 271 milliards de dollars pour lequel elle donne des conseils de placement. La Société fournit une vaste gamme de services de planification financière et de placement afin d’aider plus de deux millions de Canadiens à atteindre leurs objectifs financiers. La Société exerce principalement ses activités par l’entremise d’IG Gestion de patrimoine, de Placements Mackenzie et d’Investment Planning Counsel .

Placements Mackenzie adhère au modèle d’entreprise unique de la Financière IGM qui repose sur des marques de premier plan et sur une stratégie de distribution multicanal. Fondée en 1967, Placements Mackenzie est un partenaire de gestion d’actif de type holistique pour des milliers de conseillers financiers et les investisseurs canadiens.

Placements... Mackenzie vous offre la possibilité de vous bâtir une carrière en toute confiance .

Notre vision et notre stratégie bousculent la façon de mener les affaires dans notre secteur et aident les Canadiens à connaître le succès de la manière la plus significative pour eux. En tant que membre de notre équipe, vous aurez l’occasion de donner le meilleur de vous-même, de développer certaines de vos aptitudes les plus utiles et de poser des gestes qui contribuent au mieux-être des Canadiens. Nous sommes fiers d’avoir été désignés parmi les 100 meilleurs employeurs du Grand Toronto (2022) par Mediacorp Canada Inc. pour avoir mis à la disposition de nos employés les outils nécessaires pour réussir la transition au télétravail, tout en leur offrant des ressources en vue d’assurer d’abord leur bien-être physique et mental.

Joignez-vous à une équipe dynamique qui cherche à continuer à apprendre, à cerner ce qui compte le plus et à partager ses connaissances. Nous proposons un environnement qui stimule votre intérêt pour le perfectionnement en vous offrant les défis et la rétroaction nécessaires pour peaufiner vos compétences et vos talents. Nous nous engageons à offrir un environnement de travail hybride lorsque cela est applicable.

Placements Mackenzie offre un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif; tout commence par un effectif de travail représentatif! Nous invitons tous les candidats qualifiés qui représentent la diversité que l’on retrouve à l’étendue du Canada à soumettre leur candidature, notamment les personnes racialisées, les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées, les membres de la communauté 2SLGBTQIA+, les personnes représentant la diversité des genres et les personnes neurodivergentes, ainsi que tous ceux et celles qui peuvent contribuer à la diversité des idées.

Notre vision : Nous inspirons confiance.

L’analyste, Soutien aux opérations, doit s’assurer de l’intégrité continue des systèmes servant aux opérations des clients et à la production de rapports. Il offre du soutien aux usagers en mettant à profit sa connaissance des systèmes et procédures utilisés pour la conservation des données clients. Le soutien consiste à faire une analyse des problèmes détectés/communiqués et à les résoudre. Les problèmes sont analysés à partir d’une série de normes de service préétablies et approuvées par la direction. La personne titulaire du poste se charge des activités de détection, de prévention et d’atténuation des situations problématiques, dans le but d’en réduire les répercussions sur les clients et les utilisateurs des systèmes.

Responsabilités
• Gérer la configuration pour répondre aux besoins d’affaires dans le respect des contrôles en place, ce qui inclut la mise à l’essai de modifications et l’examen de base des frais décrits dans le prospectus.
• Coordonner les mises à jour de systèmes de bout en bout pour les lancements de produits.
• Coordonner et tester la C-SOX conformément aux contrôles établis.
• Procéder à des essais d’acceptation des utilisateurs afin de valider les changements aux règles et aux systèmes de gestion.
• Tenir les statistiques et les tableaux de bord.
• Examiner et conserver la documentation.
• Coordonner la production des envois réglementaires, le contrôle de la qualité et la gestion des problèmes.
• Offrir du soutien aux produits et aux opérations :
• Fournir aux clients des documents d’information exacts en temps utile, incluant les relevés des clients, les feuillets d’impôt, les avis d’exécution et les aperçus des fonds.
• Répondre aux demandes de renseignements des entreprises, des partenaires externes et des fournisseurs.
• Trouver la cause des problèmes de systèmes et les consigner, soumettre des correctifs aux fichiers et recommander des améliorations aux systèmes.
• Collaborer avec les développeurs et les équipes de soutien aux applications pour résoudre les problèmes.
• Participer aux projets dans l’ensemble d’IGM qui ont des répercussions sur les systèmes et les processus d’affaires.

Compétences Requises
• Trois ans d’expérience en administration des affaires ou diplôme d’études postsecondaires ou diplôme en administration des affaires ou dans une discipline pertinente.
• Connaissance de la gamme de produits et des produits spécialisés d’IGM.
• Expérience pertinente des processus, règles, procédures et résultats d’affaires.
• Expérience pertinente de la façon dont les données des clients sont conservées dans les systèmes de l’agent des transferts.
• Connaissances avancées de la façon dont les opérations financières sont calculées ou déclarées ou expertise dans le traitement des opérations.
• Apprenant autonome et adaptatif ayant une bonne capacité d’analyse pour soutenir les nombreuses applications d’IGM.
• Solides connaissances des produits de la suite Microsoft, notamment Word, Excel (connaissances avancées) et MS Access.
• Connaissance souhaitable de SQL ou VBA.
• La réussite du cours sur les fonds d’investissement au Canada ou du cours sur les opérations des fonds d’investissement, ainsi que du cours sur le commerce des valeurs mobilières au Canada est souhaitable.

Nous vous invitons à consulter notre page « Carrières » en cliquan t sur le lien : https://www.mackenzieinvestments.com/fr/careers

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt envers Placements Mackenzie. Toutefois, seuls les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés.

Placements Mackenzie est un employeur accessible qui s’engage à offrir une expérience de recrutement sans obstacle. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation ou que cette information soit présentée dans un autre format à tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, veuillez communiquer avec l’équipe Acquisition des talents qui verra à répondre à vos besoins.

Pour postuler, faites parvenir votre candidature d’ici le Novembre 27, 2023

jobs.title: Application Architect (2-FA-C)
jobs.description:
Application Architect for the Government of Ontario

Requirements/Must-Haves:

Oracle Certification: Must be a certified Oracle Middleware Lead.

Oracle Access Manager Experience: Minimum 3 years of experience with OAM 11g and 12c, especially in web application integration using webgate (installation, configuration, and troubleshooting) and OAM Federation.

Protocol Knowledge: Familiarity with SAML 2.0, OAuth/OIDC integration protocols and hands-on experience configuring Service Provider and Identity Provider using Oracle Access Manager command line tool.

IAM Systems Experience: 5+ years in the sustainment of large IAM systems, with at least 3 years related to Oracle Identity and Access Management Suite Plus and 4 years in implementations with over 10,000 registered users.

Large Application Implementations: 5+ years in designing, developing, deploying, and sustaining large application implementations, especially those built on technology products like Oracle Fusion Middleware... Oracle IAM Suite, and others.

Incident and Problem Management: 5+ years of experience in troubleshooting, analyzing, diagnosing, and resolving application problems, especially those related to IAM systems.

Quality Assurance: 5+ years in quality control and assurance methodologies and practices, especially in large applications with over 10,000 users.

Experience with Oracle Unified Methodology (OUM): At least 3 years of experience for COTS implementations.

Oracle Middleware Implementation Experience: Must have hands-on experience in Oracle Middleware Implementation.

OUD/ODSEE Migration/Upgrade Experience: Must be proficient in OUD/ODSEE migration and upgrade processes.

Nice to Have:
• Experience with Azure AD
• Prior work experience with Oracle
• Insight into Oracle product workings
• Experience on similar types of projects

Job Responsibilities:

As an Application Architect, you will be primarily responsible for thinking out and specifying the overall structure, logical components, and the logical interrelationships of computer systems, networks, or other conceptions. Your role is essential in defining the structure and relationship among applications, considering re-usable components, quality level metrics, organization, layering of software, and determination of interfaces.

Key Responsibilities Include:

Application and System Architecture:Develop, implement, and manage cross-platform applications in large and distributed environments.
Monitor the entire system, understanding interactions between components at various abstraction levels.
Define limitations and requirements for source code.

Middleware and Database Interaction:Define interactions between application packages, databases, and middleware systems.
Have extensive experience with at least two different computing platforms, operating systems, database technologies, programming languages, and communication protocols.

Enterprise Architecture:Develop enterprise architecture deliverables, including models based on specific methodologies, processes, and practices.
Possess knowledge and understanding of Information Management principles, policies, and practices.

Quality Assurance:Involve in quality control and assurance methodologies and practices for large applications implementations.
Experience with automated testing tools and methodologies.

Communication Skills: Possess excellent analytical, problem-solving, decision-making skills.
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal and negotiation skills.
Be a team player with a proven track record of meeting deadlines.

Working Conditions:

This is a hybrid role requiring up to 3 days on-site and 2 days remote working. The closing date for application is 10-16-2023 @ 11:30 AM.

2-FA-C

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 11 months

Salary: $112.00 per hour

Expected hours: 36 – 40 per week

Flexible Language Requirement:
• French not required

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:
• Toronto, ON M5B 2B8: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Toronto, ON M5B 2B8

Application deadline: 2023-10-16
Expected start date: 2023-11-01

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.description:
About the job:

As an entrepreneurial technology company, we offer an open and fast-paced environment that fosters creativity, collaboration, and enjoyment. Every day will be different, and every contribution will be valued, regardless of one’s position. We believe in the limitless opportunity of the mobile-first Omni-Channel advertising market, with a priority on in-house training and knowledge sharing between our technology and business teams. Working at Native Touch is a rewarding experience that provides flexible working conditions and the ability to maintain a strong work/life balance.

The Role:

We are looking for a contractual Senior Software Developer for a custom solutions team. Your role will be to architect and Implement custom solutions for a number of different business teams while maintaining clean readable code. You should have an understanding of how to design efficient distributed systems using a major CSP. In this role, you will contribute to multiple different... types of projects and initiatives, With the main focus being on Process automation, Big Data analytics, AI/LLM, Machine learning, and DevOps.

The Profile:

As the ideal candidate, you are someone with a significant amount of software development experience. You love to learn, you are not confined to one language, can jump in anywhere and enjoy solving problems, and do not back into a corner when faced with a complex technical challenge.

What You’ll Be Doing:

· Work closely with operations to rapidly implement and design custom solutions

· Coordinate and integrate custom solutions into a larger Ad-Tech ecosystem

· Improving POC code received from the business and engineering teams

· Identify bottlenecks and propose solutions to resolve them

· Setting the architectural and technical direction for custom solution products

Does This Sound Like You?

· Minimum of 4+ years of software development experience

· Minimum of 2+ years of proven system design experience

· Minimum of 2+ years of experience working with a cloud platform such as AWS

· Proficiency in an OOL language and familiarity with distributed system design

· Proficiency in a scripting language such as Bash, Python

· Proficiency with Docker and Event-Driven Architecture

· Proficient with SQL and writing large queries

· Mastery of working in the Linux development environment

· Excellent communication skills

Bonus skills

· Experience with Machine Learning Frameworks, AI, and LLM tools

· Experience with infrastructure as code, such as Terraform and Ansible

Benefits:

Competitive salaries

Full benefits package

Training and Development opportunities

Ability to maintain a work/life balance
